ThresholdMetricId.documentation: n an alarm based on an anomaly detection model, this is the ID of the ANOMALY_DETECTION_BAND function used as the threshold for the alarm.

TreatMissingData.documentation: Sets how this alarm is to handle missing data points.

Unit.documentation: The unit of the metric associated with the alarm.

AwsCloudWatchAlarmDimensionsDetails.documentation: Details about the dimensions for the metric associated with the alarm.

AwsCodeBuildProjectArtifactsDetails.documentation: Information about the build artifacts for the CodeBuild project.

EncryptionDisabled.documentation: Indicates whether to disable encryption on the artifact. Only valid when Type is S3.

Location.documentation: Only used when Type is S3. The name of the S3 bucket where the artifact is located.

Name.documentation: Only used when Type is S3. The name of the artifact. Used with NamepaceType and Path to determine the pattern for storing the artifact.

NamespaceType.documentation: Only used when Type is S3. The value to use for the namespace. Used with Name and Path to determine the pattern for storing the artifact.

OverrideArtifactName.documentation: Whether the name specified in the buildspec file overrides the artifact name.

Packaging.documentation: Only used when Type is S3. The type of output artifact to create.

Path.documentation: Only used when Type is S3. The path to the artifact. Used with Name and NamespaceType to determine the pattern for storing the artifact.

Type.documentation: The type of build artifact.

Artifacts.documentation: Information about the build artifacts for the CodeBuild project.

EncryptionKey.documentation:
The KMS key used to encrypt the build output artifacts.

You can specify either the ARN of the KMS key or, if available, the KMS key alias (using the format alias/alias-name).

Environment.documentation: Information about the build environment for this build project.

LogsConfig.documentation: Information about logs for the build project.

SecondaryArtifacts.documentation: Information about the secondary artifacts for the CodeBuild project.

ServiceRole.documentation: The ARN of the IAM role that enables CodeBuild to interact with dependent Amazon Web Services services on behalf of the Amazon Web Services account.

Source.documentation: Information about the build input source code for this build project.

VpcConfig.documentation: Information about the VPC configuration that CodeBuild accesses.

AwsCodeBuildProjectEnvironment.documentation: Information about the build environment for this build project.

Certificate.documentation: The certificate to use with this build project.

EnvironmentVariables.documentation: A set of environment variables to make available to builds for the build project.

ImagePullCredentialsType.documentation:
The type of credentials CodeBuild uses to pull images in your build.

Valid values:

  • CODEBUILD specifies that CodeBuild uses its own credentials. This requires that you modify your ECR repository policy to trust the CodeBuild service principal.

  • SERVICE_ROLE specifies that CodeBuild uses your build project's service role.

When you use a cross-account or private registry image, you must use SERVICE_ROLE credentials. When you use an CodeBuild curated image, you must use CODEBUILD credentials.

PrivilegedMode.documentation: Whether to allow the Docker daemon to run inside a Docker container. Set to true if the build project is used to build Docker images.

RegistryCredential.documentation: The credentials for access to a private registry.

Type.documentation:
The type of build environment to use for related builds.

The environment type ARM_CONTAINER is available only in Regions US East (N. Virginia), US East (Ohio), US West (Oregon), Europe (Ireland), Asia Pacific (Mumbai), Asia Pacific (Tokyo), Asia Pacific (Sydney), and Europe (Frankfurt).

The environment type LINUX_CONTAINER with compute type build.general1.2xlarge is available only in Regions US East (N. Virginia), US East (N. Virginia), US West (Oregon), Canada (Central), Europe (Ireland), Europe (London), Europe (Frankfurt), Asia Pacific (Tokyo), Asia Pacific (Seoul), Asia Pacific (Singapore), Asia Pacific (Sydney), China (Beijing), and China (Ningxia).

The environment type LINUX_GPU_CONTAINER is available only in Regions US East (N. Virginia), US East (N. Virginia), US West (Oregon), Canada (Central), Europe (Ireland), Europe (London), Europe (Frankfurt), Asia Pacific (Tokyo), Asia Pacific (Seoul), Asia Pacific (Singapore), Asia Pacific (Sydney), China (Beijing), and China (Ningxia).

Valid values: WINDOWS_CONTAINER | LINUX_CONTAINER | LINUX_GPU_CONTAINER | ARM_CONTAINER

AwsCodeBuildProjectEnvironmentEnvironmen.documentation: Information about an environment variable that is available to builds for the build project.

Type.documentation: The type of environment variable.

AwsCodeBuildProjectEnvironmentRegistryCr.documentation: The credentials for access to a private registry.

Credential.documentation:
The ARN or name of credentials created using Secrets Manager.

The credential can use the name of the credentials only if they exist in your current Amazon Web Services Region.

CredentialProvider.documentation:
The service that created the credentials to access a private Docker registry.

The valid value, SECRETS_MANAGER, is for Secrets Manager.

AwsCodeBuildProjectLogsConfigCloudWatchL.documentation: Information about CloudWatch Logs for the build project.

GroupName.documentation: The group name of the logs in CloudWatch Logs.

Status.documentation: The current status of the logs in CloudWatch Logs for a build project.

StreamName.documentation: The prefix of the stream name of the CloudWatch Logs.

AwsCodeBuildProjectLogsConfigDetails.documentation: Information about logs for the build project.

CloudWatchLogs.documentation: Information about CloudWatch Logs for the build project.

S3Logs.documentation: Information about logs built to an S3 bucket for a build project.

AwsCodeBuildProjectLogsConfigS3LogsDetai.documentation: Information about logs built to an S3 bucket for a build project.

EncryptionDisabled.documentation: Whether to disable encryption of the S3 build log output.

Location.documentation: The ARN of the S3 bucket and the path prefix for S3 logs.

Status.documentation: The current status of the S3 build logs.

AwsCodeBuildProjectSource.documentation: Information about the build input source code for this build project.

GitCloneDepth.documentation: Information about the Git clone depth for the build project.

InsecureSsl.documentation: Whether to ignore SSL warnings while connecting to the project source code.

Location.documentation:
Information about the location of the source code to be built.

Valid values include:

  • For source code settings that are specified in the source action of a pipeline in CodePipeline, location should not be specified. If it is specified, CodePipeline ignores it. This is because CodePipeline uses the settings in a pipeline's source action instead of this value.

  • For source code in an CodeCommit repository, the HTTPS clone URL to the repository that contains the source code and the build spec file (for example, https://git-codecommit.region-ID.amazonaws.com/v1/repos/repo-name ).

  • For source code in an S3 input bucket, one of the following.

    • The path to the ZIP file that contains the source code (for example, bucket-name/path/to/object-name.zip).

    • The path to the folder that contains the source code (for example, bucket-name/path/to/source-code/folder/).

  • For source code in a GitHub repository, the HTTPS clone URL to the repository that contains the source and the build spec file.

  • For source code in a Bitbucket repository, the HTTPS clone URL to the repository that contains the source and the build spec file.

Type.documentation:
The type of repository that contains the source code to be built. Valid values are:

  • BITBUCKET - The source code is in a Bitbucket repository.

  • CODECOMMIT - The source code is in an CodeCommit repository.

  • CODEPIPELINE - The source code settings are specified in the source action of a pipeline in CodePipeline.

  • GITHUB - The source code is in a GitHub repository.

  • GITHUB_ENTERPRISE - The source code is in a GitHub Enterprise repository.

  • NO_SOURCE - The project does not have input source code.

  • S3 - The source code is in an S3 input bucket.

AwsCodeBuildProjectVpcConfig.documentation: Information about the VPC configuration that CodeBuild accesses.

SecurityGroupIds.documentation: A list of one or more security group IDs in your VPC.

Subnets.documentation: A list of one or more subnet IDs in your VPC.

AwsCorsConfiguration.documentation: Contains the cross-origin resource sharing (CORS) configuration for the API. CORS is only supported for HTTP APIs.

AllowCredentials.documentation: Indicates whether the CORS request includes credentials.

MaxAge.documentation: The number of seconds for which the browser caches preflight request results.

AwsDynamoDbTableAttributeDefinition.documentation: Contains a definition of an attribute for the table.

AwsDynamoDbTableBillingModeSummary.documentation: Provides information about the billing for read/write capacity on the table.

BillingMode.documentation: The method used to charge for read and write throughput and to manage capacity.

LastUpdateToPayPerRequestDateTime.documentation:
If the billing mode is PAY_PER_REQUEST, indicates when the billing mode was set to that value.

Uses the date-time format specified in RFC 3339 section 5.6, Internet Date/Time Format. The value cannot contain spaces. For example, 2020-03-22T13:22:13.933Z.

AttributeDefinitions.documentation: A list of attribute definitions for the table.

BillingModeSummary.documentation: Information about the billing for read/write capacity on the table.

CreationDateTime.documentation:
Indicates when the table was created.

Uses the date-time format specified in RFC 3339 section 5.6, Internet Date/Time Format. The value cannot contain spaces. For example, 2020-03-22T13:22:13.933Z.

GlobalSecondaryIndexes.documentation: List of global secondary indexes for the table.

GlobalTableVersion.documentation: The version of global tables being used.

ItemCount.documentation: The number of items in the table.

KeySchema.documentation: The primary key structure for the table.

LatestStreamArn.documentation: The ARN of the latest stream for the table.

LatestStreamLabel.documentation: The label of the latest stream. The label is not a unique identifier.

LocalSecondaryIndexes.documentation: The list of local secondary indexes for the table.

ProvisionedThroughput.documentation: Information about the provisioned throughput for the table.

Replicas.documentation: The list of replicas of this table.

RestoreSummary.documentation: Information about the restore for the table.

SseDescription.documentation: Information about the server-side encryption for the table.

StreamSpecification.documentation: The current DynamoDB Streams configuration for the table.

TableSizeBytes.documentation: The total size of the table in bytes.

TableStatus.documentation:
The current status of the table. Valid values are as follows:

  • ACTIVE

  • ARCHIVED

  • ARCHIVING

  • CREATING

  • DELETING

  • INACCESSIBLE_ENCRYPTION_CREDENTIALS

  • UPDATING

AwsDynamoDbTableGlobalSecondaryIndex.documentation: Information abut a global secondary index for the table.

IndexSizeBytes.documentation: The total size in bytes of the index.

ItemCount.documentation: The number of items in the index.

Projection.documentation: Attributes that are copied from the table into an index.

ProvisionedThroughput.documentation: Information about the provisioned throughput settings for the indexes.

AwsDynamoDbTableKeySchema.documentation: A component of the key schema for the DynamoDB table, a global secondary index, or a local secondary index.

AttributeName.documentation: The name of the key schema attribute.

KeyType.documentation: The type of key used for the key schema attribute. Valid values are HASH or RANGE.

AwsDynamoDbTableLocalSecondaryIndex.documentation: Information about a local secondary index for a DynamoDB table.

KeySchema.documentation: The complete key schema for the index.

Projection.documentation: Attributes that are copied from the table into the index. These are in addition to the primary key attributes and index key attributes, which are automatically projected.

AwsDynamoDbTableProjection.documentation: For global and local secondary indexes, identifies the attributes that are copied from the table into the index.

NonKeyAttributes.documentation: The nonkey attributes that are projected into the index. For each attribute, provide the attribute name.

ProjectionType.documentation:
The types of attributes that are projected into the index. Valid values are as follows:

  • ALL

  • INCLUDE

  • KEYS_ONLY

AwsDynamoDbTableProvisionedThroughput.documentation: Information about the provisioned throughput for the table or for a global secondary index.

LastDecreaseDateTime.documentation:
Indicates when the provisioned throughput was last decreased.

Uses the date-time format specified in RFC 3339 section 5.6, Internet Date/Time Format. The value cannot contain spaces. For example, 2020-03-22T13:22:13.933Z.

LastIncreaseDateTime.documentation:
Indicates when the provisioned throughput was last increased.

Uses the date-time format specified in RFC 3339 section 5.6, Internet Date/Time Format. The value cannot contain spaces. For example, 2020-03-22T13:22:13.933Z.

NumberOfDecreasesToday.documentation: The number of times during the current UTC calendar day that the provisioned throughput was decreased.

ReadCapacityUnits.documentation: The maximum number of strongly consistent reads consumed per second before DynamoDB returns a ThrottlingException.

WriteCapacityUnits.documentation: The maximum number of writes consumed per second before DynamoDB returns a ThrottlingException.

ReadCapacityUnits.documentation: The read capacity units for the replica.

AwsDynamoDbTableReplica.documentation: Information about a replica of a DynamoDB table.

GlobalSecondaryIndexes.documentation: List of global secondary indexes for the replica.

KmsMasterKeyId.documentation: The identifier of the KMS key that will be used for KMS encryption for the replica.

RegionName.documentation: The name of the Region where the replica is located.

ReplicaStatus.documentation:
The current status of the replica. Valid values are as follows:

  • ACTIVE

  • CREATING

  • CREATION_FAILED

  • DELETING

  • UPDATING

AwsDynamoDbTableReplicaGlobalSecondaryIn.documentation: Information about a global secondary index for a DynamoDB table replica.

ProvisionedThroughputOverride.documentation: Replica-specific configuration for the provisioned throughput for the index.

AwsDynamoDbTableRestoreSummary.documentation: Information about the restore for the table.

RestoreDateTime.documentation:
Indicates the point in time that the table was restored to.

Uses the date-time format specified in RFC 3339 section 5.6, Internet Date/Time Format. The value cannot contain spaces. For example, 2020-03-22T13:22:13.933Z.

RestoreInProgress.documentation: Whether a restore is currently in progress.

SourceBackupArn.documentation: The ARN of the source backup from which the table was restored.

SourceTableArn.documentation: The ARN of the source table for the backup.

AwsDynamoDbTableSseDescription.documentation: Information about the server-side encryption for the table.

InaccessibleEncryptionDateTime.documentation:
If the key is inaccessible, the date and time when DynamoDB detected that the key was inaccessible.

Uses the date-time format specified in RFC 3339 section 5.6, Internet Date/Time Format. The value cannot contain spaces. For example, 2020-03-22T13:22:13.933Z.

KmsMasterKeyArn.documentation: The ARN of the KMS key that is used for the KMS encryption.

Status.documentation: The status of the server-side encryption.

AwsDynamoDbTableStreamSpecification.documentation: The current DynamoDB Streams configuration for the table.

StreamEnabled.documentation: Indicates whether DynamoDB Streams is enabled on the table.

StreamViewType.documentation: Determines the information that is written to the table.

AllocationId.documentation: The identifier that Amazon Web Services assigns to represent the allocation of the Elastic IP address for use with Amazon VPC.

AssociationId.documentation: The identifier that represents the association of the Elastic IP address with an EC2 instance.

Domain.documentation:
The domain in which to allocate the address.

If the address is for use with EC2 instances in a VPC, then Domain is vpc. Otherwise, Domain is standard.

NetworkBorderGroup.documentation: The name of the location from which the Elastic IP address is advertised.

NetworkInterfaceOwnerId.documentation: The Amazon Web Services account ID of the owner of the network interface.

PrivateIpAddress.documentation: The private IP address that is associated with the Elastic IP address.

PublicIp.documentation: A public IP address that is associated with the EC2 instance.

PublicIpv4Pool.documentation: The identifier of an IP address pool. This parameter allows Amazon EC2 to select an IP address from the address pool.

AwsEc2InstanceDetails.documentation: The details of an Amazon EC2 instance.

IamInstanceProfileArn.documentation: The IAM profile ARN of the instance.

ImageId.documentation: The Amazon Machine Image (AMI) ID of the instance.

IpV4Addresses.documentation: The IPv4 addresses associated with the instance.

IpV6Addresses.documentation: The IPv6 addresses associated with the instance.

KeyName.documentation: The key name associated with the instance.

LaunchedAt.documentation:
Indicates when the instance was launched.

Uses the date-time format specified in RFC 3339 section 5.6, Internet Date/Time Format. The value cannot contain spaces. For example, 2020-03-22T13:22:13.933Z.

MetadataOptions.documentation: Details about the metadata options for the Amazon EC2 instance.

NetworkInterfaces.documentation: The identifiers of the network interfaces for the EC2 instance. The details for each network interface are in a corresponding AwsEc2NetworkInterfacesDetails object.

SubnetId.documentation: The identifier of the subnet that the instance was launched in.

Type.documentation: The instance type of the instance.

VirtualizationType.documentation: The virtualization type of the Amazon Machine Image (AMI) required to launch the instance.

VpcId.documentation: The identifier of the VPC that the instance was launched in.

AwsEc2InstanceMetadataOptions.documentation: Metadata options that allow you to configure and secure the Amazon EC2 instance.

HttpEndpoint.documentation: Enables or disables the HTTP metadata endpoint on the instance.

HttpProtocolIpv6.documentation: Enables or disables the IPv6 endpoint for the instance metadata service.

HttpPutResponseHopLimit.documentation: The desired HTTP PUT response hop limit for instance metadata requests. The larger the number, the further instance metadata requests can travel.

HttpTokens.documentation: The state of token usage for your instance metadata requests.

InstanceMetadataTags.documentation: Specifies whether to allow access to instance tags from the instance metadata.

AwsEc2InstanceNetworkInterfacesDetails.documentation: Identifies a network interface for the Amazon EC2 instance.

NetworkInterfaceId.documentation: The identifier of the network interface. The details are in a corresponding AwsEc2NetworkInterfacesDetails object.

AwsEc2NetworkAclAssociation.documentation: An association between the network ACL and a subnet.

NetworkAclAssociationId.documentation: The identifier of the association between the network ACL and the subnet.

SubnetId.documentation: The identifier of the subnet that is associated with the network ACL.

AwsEc2NetworkAclDetails.documentation: Contains details about an Amazon EC2 network access control list (ACL).

Associations.documentation: Associations between the network ACL and subnets.

Entries.documentation: The set of rules in the network ACL.

IsDefault.documentation: Whether this is the default network ACL for the VPC.

OwnerId.documentation: The identifier of the Amazon Web Services account that owns the network ACL.

VpcId.documentation: The identifier of the VPC for the network ACL.

AwsEc2NetworkAclEntry.documentation: A rule for the network ACL. Each rule allows or denies access based on the IP address, traffic direction, port, and protocol.

CidrBlock.documentation: The IPV4 network range for which to deny or allow access.

Egress.documentation: Whether the rule is an egress rule. An egress rule is a rule that applies to traffic that leaves the subnet.

IcmpTypeCode.documentation: The Internet Control Message Protocol (ICMP) type and code for which to deny or allow access.

Ipv6CidrBlock.documentation: The IPV6 network range for which to deny or allow access.

PortRange.documentation: For TCP or UDP protocols, the range of ports that the rule applies to.

Protocol.documentation: The protocol that the rule applies to. To deny or allow access to all protocols, use the value -1.

RuleAction.documentation: Whether the rule is used to allow access or deny access.

RuleNumber.documentation: The rule number. The rules are processed in order by their number.

AttachTime.documentation:
Indicates when the attachment initiated.

Uses the date-time format specified in RFC 3339 section 5.6, Internet Date/Time Format. The value cannot contain spaces. For example, 2020-03-22T13:22:13.933Z.

AttachmentId.documentation: The identifier of the network interface attachment

DeleteOnTermination.documentation: Indicates whether the network interface is deleted when the instance is terminated.

DeviceIndex.documentation: The device index of the network interface attachment on the instance.

InstanceOwnerId.documentation: The Amazon Web Services account ID of the owner of the instance.

Status.documentation:
The attachment state.

Valid values: attaching | attached | detaching | detached

IpV6Addresses.documentation: The IPv6 addresses associated with the network interface.

PrivateIpAddresses.documentation: The private IPv4 addresses associated with the network interface.

PublicDnsName.documentation: The public DNS name of the network interface.

PublicIp.documentation: The address of the Elastic IP address bound to the network interface.

SourceDestCheck.documentation: Indicates whether traffic to or from the instance is validated.

AwsEc2NetworkInterfaceIpV6AddressDetail.documentation: Provides information about an IPV6 address that is associated with the network interface.

AwsEc2NetworkInterfacePrivateIpAddressDe.documentation: Provides information about a private IPv4 address that is with the network interface.

PrivateDnsName.documentation: The private DNS name for the IP address.

AwsEc2NetworkInterfaceSecurityGroup.documentation: A security group associated with the network interface.

AwsEc2SecurityGroupDetails.documentation: Details about an Amazon EC2 security group.

IpPermissions.documentation: The inbound rules associated with the security group.

IpPermissionsEgress.documentation: [VPC only] The outbound rules associated with the security group.

OwnerId.documentation: The Amazon Web Services account ID of the owner of the security group.

VpcId.documentation: [VPC only] The ID of the VPC for the security group.

AwsEc2SecurityGroupIpPermission.documentation: An IP permission for an EC2 security group.

FromPort.documentation:
The start of the port range for the TCP and UDP protocols, or an ICMP/ICMPv6 type number.

A value of -1 indicates all ICMP/ICMPv6 types. If you specify all ICMP/ICMPv6 types, you must specify all codes.

IpProtocol.documentation:
The IP protocol name (tcp, udp, icmp, icmpv6) or number.

[VPC only] Use -1 to specify all protocols.

When authorizing security group rules, specifying -1 or a protocol number other than tcp, udp, icmp, or icmpv6 allows traffic on all ports, regardless of any port range you specify.

For tcp, udp, and icmp, you must specify a port range.

For icmpv6, the port range is optional. If you omit the port range, traffic for all types and codes is allowed.

PrefixListIds.documentation: [VPC only] The prefix list IDs for an Amazon Web Services service. With outbound rules, this is the Amazon Web Services service to access through a VPC endpoint from instances associated with the security group.

ToPort.documentation:
The end of the port range for the TCP and UDP protocols, or an ICMP/ICMPv6 code.

A value of -1 indicates all ICMP/ICMPv6 codes. If you specify all ICMP/ICMPv6 types, you must specify all codes.

UserIdGroupPairs.documentation: The security group and Amazon Web Services account ID pairs.

CidrIp.documentation: The IPv4 CIDR range. You can specify either a CIDR range or a source security group, but not both. To specify a single IPv4 address, use the /32 prefix length.

CidrIpv6.documentation: The IPv6 CIDR range. You can specify either a CIDR range or a source security group, but not both. To specify a single IPv6 address, use the /128 prefix length.

AwsEc2SecurityGroupUserIdGroupPair.documentation: A relationship between a security group and a user.

PeeringStatus.documentation: The status of a VPC peering connection, if applicable.

UserId.documentation:
The ID of an Amazon Web Services account.

For a referenced security group in another VPC, the account ID of the referenced security group is returned in the response. If the referenced security group is deleted, this value is not returned.

[EC2-Classic] Required when adding or removing rules that reference a security group in another VPC.

VpcId.documentation: The ID of the VPC for the referenced security group, if applicable.

VpcPeeringConnectionId.documentation: The ID of the VPC peering connection, if applicable.

AwsEc2SubnetDetails.documentation: Contains information about a subnet in Amazon EC2.

AssignIpv6AddressOnCreation.documentation: Whether to assign an IPV6 address to a network interface that is created in this subnet.

AvailabilityZoneId.documentation: The identifier of the Availability Zone for the subnet.

AvailableIpAddressCount.documentation: The number of available IPV4 addresses in the subnet. Does not include addresses for stopped instances.

CidrBlock.documentation: The IPV4 CIDR block that is assigned to the subnet.

DefaultForAz.documentation: Whether this subnet is the default subnet for the Availability Zone.

Ipv6CidrBlockAssociationSet.documentation: The IPV6 CIDR blocks that are associated with the subnet.

MapPublicIpOnLaunch.documentation: Whether instances in this subnet receive a public IP address.

OwnerId.documentation: The identifier of the Amazon Web Services account that owns the subnet.

State.documentation: The current state of the subnet. Valid values are available or pending.

VpcId.documentation: The identifier of the VPC that contains the subnet.

AwsEc2TransitGatewayDetails.documentation: Information about an Amazon Web Services Amazon EC2 Transit Gateway that interconnects virtual private clouds (VPCs) and on-premises networks.

AmazonSideAsn.documentation: A private Autonomous System Number (ASN) for the Amazon side of a BGP session.

AssociationDefaultRouteTableId.documentation: The ID of the default association route table.

AutoAcceptSharedAttachments.documentation: Turn on or turn off automatic acceptance of attachment requests.

DefaultRouteTableAssociation.documentation: Turn on or turn off automatic association with the default association route table.

DefaultRouteTablePropagation.documentation: Turn on or turn off automatic propagation of routes to the default propagation route table.

DnsSupport.documentation: Turn on or turn off DNS support.

MulticastSupport.documentation: Indicates whether multicast is supported on the transit gateway.

PropagationDefaultRouteTableId.documentation: The ID of the default propagation route table.

TransitGatewayCidrBlocks.documentation: The transit gateway Classless Inter-Domain Routing (CIDR) blocks.

VpnEcmpSupport.documentation: Turn on or turn off Equal Cost Multipath Protocol (ECMP) support.

AwsEc2VolumeAttachment.documentation: An attachment to an Amazon EC2 volume.

DeleteOnTermination.documentation: Whether the EBS volume is deleted when the EC2 instance is terminated.

Status.documentation:
The attachment state of the volume. Valid values are as follows:

  • attaching

  • attached

  • busy

  • detaching

  • detached

CreateTime.documentation:
Indicates when the volume was created.

Uses the date-time format specified in RFC 3339 section 5.6, Internet Date/Time Format. The value cannot contain spaces. For example, 2020-03-22T13:22:13.933Z.

DeviceName.documentation: The device name for the volume that is attached to the instance.

KmsKeyId.documentation: The ARN of the KMS key that was used to protect the volume encryption key for the volume.

Size.documentation: The size of the volume, in GiBs.

SnapshotId.documentation: The snapshot from which the volume was created.

Status.documentation:
The volume state. Valid values are as follows:

  • available

  • creating

  • deleted

  • deleting

  • error

  • in-use

VolumeScanStatus.documentation: Indicates whether the volume was scanned or skipped.

CidrBlockAssociationSet.documentation: Information about the IPv4 CIDR blocks associated with the VPC.

DhcpOptionsId.documentation: The identifier of the set of Dynamic Host Configuration Protocol (DHCP) options that are associated with the VPC. If the default options are associated with the VPC, then this is default.

Ipv6CidrBlockAssociationSet.documentation: Information about the IPv6 CIDR blocks associated with the VPC.

State.documentation: The current state of the VPC. Valid values are available or pending.

AwsEc2VpcEndpointServiceDetails.documentation: Contains details about the service configuration for a VPC endpoint service.

AcceptanceRequired.documentation: Whether requests from other Amazon Web Services accounts to create an endpoint to the service must first be accepted.

AvailabilityZones.documentation: The Availability Zones where the service is available.

GatewayLoadBalancerArns.documentation: The ARNs of the Gateway Load Balancers for the service.

ManagesVpcEndpoints.documentation: Whether the service manages its VPC endpoints.

NetworkLoadBalancerArns.documentation: The ARNs of the Network Load Balancers for the service.

PrivateDnsName.documentation: The private DNS name for the service.

ServiceState.documentation:
The current state of the service. Valid values are as follows:

  • Available

  • Deleted

  • Deleting

  • Failed

  • Pending

AwsEc2VpcEndpointServiceServiceTypeDetai.documentation: The service type information for a VPC endpoint service.

AwsEc2VpcPeeringConnectionDetails.documentation: Provides information about a VPC peering connection between two VPCs: a requester VPC that you own and an accepter VPC with which to create the connection.

ExpirationTime.documentation: The time at which an unaccepted VPC peering connection will expire.

Status.documentation: The status of the VPC peering connection.

VpcPeeringConnectionId.documentation: The ID of the VPC peering connection.

AwsEc2VpcPeeringConnectionStatusDetails.documentation: Details about the status of the VPC peering connection.

Code.documentation: The status of the VPC peering connection.

Message.documentation: A message that provides more information about the status, if applicable.

AwsEc2VpcPeeringConnectionVpcInfoDetails.documentation: Describes a VPC in a VPC peering connection.

CidrBlock.documentation: The IPv4 CIDR block for the VPC.

CidrBlockSet.documentation: Information about the IPv4 CIDR blocks for the VPC.

Ipv6CidrBlockSet.documentation: The IPv6 CIDR block for the VPC.

OwnerId.documentation: The ID of the Amazon Web Services account that owns the VPC.

PeeringOptions.documentation: Information about the VPC peering connection options for the accepter or requester VPC.

Region.documentation: The Amazon Web Services Region in which the VPC is located.

AwsEc2VpnConnectionDetails.documentation: Details about an Amazon EC2 VPN connection.

Category.documentation: The category of the VPN connection. VPN indicates an Amazon Web Services VPN connection. VPN-Classic indicates an Amazon Web Services Classic VPN connection.

CustomerGatewayConfiguration.documentation: The configuration information for the VPN connection's customer gateway, in the native XML format.

CustomerGatewayId.documentation: The identifier of the customer gateway that is at your end of the VPN connection.

Routes.documentation: The static routes that are associated with the VPN connection.

State.documentation:
The current state of the VPN connection. Valid values are as follows:

  • available

  • deleted

  • deleting

  • pending

TransitGatewayId.documentation: The identifier of the transit gateway that is associated with the VPN connection.

Type.documentation: The type of VPN connection.

VpnGatewayId.documentation: The identifier of the virtual private gateway that is at the Amazon Web Services side of the VPN connection.

StaticRoutesOnly.documentation: Whether the VPN connection uses static routes only.

DpdTimeoutSeconds.documentation: The number of seconds after which a Dead Peer Detection (DPD) timeout occurs.

IkeVersions.documentation: The Internet Key Exchange (IKE) versions that are permitted for the VPN tunnel.

OutsideIpAddress.documentation: The external IP address of the VPN tunnel.

Phase1DhGroupNumbers.documentation: The permitted Diffie-Hellman group numbers for the VPN tunnel for phase 1 IKE negotiations.

Phase1EncryptionAlgorithms.documentation: The permitted encryption algorithms for the VPN tunnel for phase 1 IKE negotiations.

Phase1IntegrityAlgorithms.documentation: The permitted integrity algorithms for the VPN tunnel for phase 1 IKE negotiations.

Phase1LifetimeSeconds.documentation: The lifetime for phase 1 of the IKE negotiation, in seconds.

Phase2DhGroupNumbers.documentation: The permitted Diffie-Hellman group numbers for the VPN tunnel for phase 2 IKE negotiations.

Phase2EncryptionAlgorithms.documentation: The permitted encryption algorithms for the VPN tunnel for phase 2 IKE negotiations.

Phase2IntegrityAlgorithms.documentation: The permitted integrity algorithms for the VPN tunnel for phase 2 IKE negotiations.

Phase2LifetimeSeconds.documentation: The lifetime for phase 2 of the IKE negotiation, in seconds.

PreSharedKey.documentation: The preshared key to establish initial authentication between the virtual private gateway and the customer gateway.

RekeyFuzzPercentage.documentation: The percentage of the rekey window, which is determined by RekeyMarginTimeSeconds during which the rekey time is randomly selected.

RekeyMarginTimeSeconds.documentation: The margin time, in seconds, before the phase 2 lifetime expires, during which the Amazon Web Services side of the VPN connection performs an IKE rekey.

ReplayWindowSize.documentation: The number of packets in an IKE replay window.

TunnelInsideCidr.documentation: The range of inside IPv4 addresses for the tunnel.

AwsEc2VpnConnectionRoutesDetails.documentation: A static routes associated with the VPN connection.

DestinationCidrBlock.documentation: The CIDR block associated with the local subnet of the customer data center.

State.documentation: The current state of the static route.

CertificateArn.documentation: The ARN of the VPN tunnel endpoint certificate.

LastStatusChange.documentation:
The date and time of the last change in status.

Uses the date-time format specified in RFC 3339 section 5.6, Internet Date/Time Format. The value cannot contain spaces. For example, 2020-03-22T13:22:13.933Z.

OutsideIpAddress.documentation: The Internet-routable IP address of the virtual private gateway's outside interface.

Status.documentation: The status of the VPN tunnel. Valid values are DOWN or UP.

StatusMessage.documentation: If an error occurs, a description of the error.

Architecture.documentation:
The architecture of the image. Valid values are as follows:

  • arm64

  • i386

  • x86_64

ImageDigest.documentation: The sha256 digest of the image manifest.

ImagePublishedAt.documentation:
The date and time when the image was pushed to the repository.

Uses the date-time format specified in RFC 3339 section 5.6, Internet Date/Time Format. The value cannot contain spaces. For example, 2020-03-22T13:22:13.933Z.

ImageTags.documentation: The list of tags that are associated with the image.

RegistryId.documentation: The Amazon Web Services account identifier that is associated with the registry that the image belongs to.

RepositoryName.documentation: The name of the repository that the image belongs to.

AwsEcrRepositoryDetails.documentation: Provides information about an Amazon Elastic Container Registry repository.

ImageScanningConfiguration.documentation: The image scanning configuration for a repository.

ImageTagMutability.documentation: The tag mutability setting for the repository. Valid values are IMMUTABLE or MUTABLE.

LifecyclePolicy.documentation: Information about the lifecycle policy for the repository.

AwsEcrRepositoryImageScanningConfigurati.documentation: The image scanning configuration for a repository.

ScanOnPush.documentation: Whether to scan images after they are pushed to a repository.

AwsEcrRepositoryLifecyclePolicyDetails.documentation: Information about the lifecycle policy for the repository.

RegistryId.documentation: The Amazon Web Services account identifier that is associated with the registry that contains the repository.

AwsEcsClusterClusterSettingsDetails.documentation: Indicates whether to enable CloudWatch Container Insights for the ECS cluster.

Name.documentation: The name of the setting. The valid value is containerInsights.

Value.documentation: The value of the setting. Valid values are disabled or enabled.

AwsEcsClusterConfigurationDetails.documentation: The run command configuration for the cluster.

ExecuteCommandConfiguration.documentation: Contains the run command configuration for the cluster.

AwsEcsClusterConfigurationExecuteCommand.documentation: Contains the run command configuration for the cluster.

KmsKeyId.documentation: The identifier of the KMS key that is used to encrypt the data between the local client and the container.

LogConfiguration.documentation: The log configuration for the results of the run command actions. Required if Logging is NONE.

Logging.documentation: The log setting to use for redirecting logs for run command results.

AwsEcsClusterConfigurationExecuteCommand.documentation: The log configuration for the results of the run command actions.

CloudWatchEncryptionEnabled.documentation: Whether to enable encryption on the CloudWatch logs.

CloudWatchLogGroupName.documentation: The name of the CloudWatch log group to send the logs to.

S3BucketName.documentation: The name of the S3 bucket to send logs to.

S3EncryptionEnabled.documentation: Whether to encrypt the logs that are sent to the S3 bucket.

S3KeyPrefix.documentation: Identifies the folder in the S3 bucket to send the logs to.

AwsEcsClusterDefaultCapacityProviderStra.documentation: The default capacity provider strategy for the cluster. The default capacity provider strategy is used when services or tasks are run without a specified launch type or capacity provider strategy.

Base.documentation: The minimum number of tasks to run on the specified capacity provider.

Weight.documentation: The relative percentage of the total number of tasks launched that should use the capacity provider.

AwsEcsClusterDetails.documentation: Provides details about an Amazon ECS cluster.

ActiveServicesCount.documentation: The number of services that are running on the cluster in an ACTIVE state. You can view these services with the Amazon ECS ListServices API operation.

CapacityProviders.documentation: The short name of one or more capacity providers to associate with the cluster.

ClusterArn.documentation: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) that identifies the cluster.

ClusterName.documentation: A name that you use to identify your cluster.

ClusterSettings.documentation: The setting to use to create the cluster. Specifically used to configure whether to enable CloudWatch Container Insights for the cluster.

Configuration.documentation: The run command configuration for the cluster.

DefaultCapacityProviderStrategy.documentation: The default capacity provider strategy for the cluster. The default capacity provider strategy is used when services or tasks are run without a specified launch type or capacity provider strategy.

RegisteredContainerInstancesCount.documentation: The number of container instances registered into the cluster. This includes container instances in both ACTIVE and DRAINING status.

RunningTasksCount.documentation: The number of tasks in the cluster that are in the RUNNING state.

Status.documentation: The status of the cluster.

AwsEcsContainerDetails.documentation: Provides information about an Amazon ECS container.

MountPoints.documentation: The mount points for data volumes in your container.

Privileged.documentation: When this parameter is true, the container is given elevated privileges on the host container instance (similar to the root user).

AwsEcsServiceCapacityProviderStrategyDet.documentation: Strategy item for the capacity provider strategy that the service uses.

Base.documentation:
The minimum number of tasks to run on the capacity provider. Only one strategy item can specify a value for Base.

The value must be between 0 and 100000.

CapacityProvider.documentation: The short name of the capacity provider.

Weight.documentation:
The relative percentage of the total number of tasks that should use the capacity provider.

If no weight is specified, the default value is 0. At least one capacity provider must have a weight greater than 0.

The value can be between 0 and 1000.

AwsEcsServiceDeploymentConfigurationDepl.documentation: Determines whether a service deployment fails if a service cannot reach a steady state.

Enable.documentation: Whether to enable the deployment circuit breaker logic for the service.

Rollback.documentation: Whether to roll back the service if a service deployment fails. If rollback is enabled, when a service deployment fails, the service is rolled back to the last deployment that completed successfully.

DeploymentCircuitBreaker.documentation: Determines whether a service deployment fails if a service cannot reach a steady state.

MaximumPercent.documentation:
For a service that uses the rolling update (ECS) deployment type, the maximum number of tasks in a service that are allowed in the RUNNING or PENDING state during a deployment, and for tasks that use the EC2 launch type, when any container instances are in the DRAINING state. Provided as a percentage of the desired number of tasks. The default value is 200%.

For a service that uses the blue/green (CODE_DEPLOY) or EXTERNAL deployment types, and tasks that use the EC2 launch type, the maximum number of tasks in the service that remain in the RUNNING state while the container instances are in the DRAINING state.

For the Fargate launch type, the maximum percent value is not used.

MinimumHealthyPercent.documentation:
For a service that uses the rolling update (ECS) deployment type, the minimum number of tasks in a service that must remain in the RUNNING state during a deployment, and while any container instances are in the DRAINING state if the service contains tasks using the EC2 launch type. Expressed as a percentage of the desired number of tasks. The default value is 100%.

For a service that uses the blue/green (CODE_DEPLOY) or EXTERNAL deployment types and tasks that use the EC2 launch type, the minimum number of the tasks in the service that remain in the RUNNING state while the container instances are in the DRAINING state.

For the Fargate launch type, the minimum healthy percent value is not used.

AwsEcsServiceDeploymentControllerDetails.documentation: Information about the deployment controller type that the service uses.

Type.documentation:
The rolling update (ECS) deployment type replaces the current running version of the container with the latest version.

The blue/green (CODE_DEPLOY) deployment type uses the blue/green deployment model that is powered by CodeDeploy. This deployment model a new deployment of a service can be verified before production traffic is sent to it.

The external (EXTERNAL) deployment type allows the use of any third-party deployment controller for full control over the deployment process for an Amazon ECS service.

Valid values: ECS | CODE_DEPLOY | EXTERNAL

AwsEcsServiceDetails.documentation: Provides details about a service within an ECS cluster.

CapacityProviderStrategy.documentation: The capacity provider strategy that the service uses.

Cluster.documentation: The ARN of the cluster that hosts the service.

DeploymentConfiguration.documentation: Deployment parameters for the service. Includes the number of tasks that run and the order in which to start and stop tasks.

DeploymentController.documentation: Contains the deployment controller type that the service uses.

DesiredCount.documentation: The number of instantiations of the task definition to run on the service.

EnableEcsManagedTags.documentation: Whether to enable Amazon ECS managed tags for the tasks in the service.

EnableExecuteCommand.documentation: Whether the execute command functionality is enabled for the service.

HealthCheckGracePeriodSeconds.documentation: After a task starts, the amount of time in seconds that the Amazon ECS service scheduler ignores unhealthy Elastic Load Balancing target health checks.

LaunchType.documentation:
The launch type that the service uses.

Valid values: EC2 | FARGATE | EXTERNAL

LoadBalancers.documentation: Information about the load balancers that the service uses.

NetworkConfiguration.documentation: For tasks that use the awsvpc networking mode, the VPC subnet and security group configuration.

PlacementConstraints.documentation: The placement constraints for the tasks in the service.

PlacementStrategies.documentation: Information about how tasks for the service are placed.

PlatformVersion.documentation: The platform version on which to run the service. Only specified for tasks that are hosted on Fargate. If a platform version is not specified, the LATEST platform version is used by default.

PropagateTags.documentation:
Indicates whether to propagate the tags from the task definition to the task or from the service to the task. If no value is provided, then tags are not propagated.

Valid values: TASK_DEFINITION | SERVICE

Role.documentation: The ARN of the IAM role that is associated with the service. The role allows the Amazon ECS container agent to register container instances with an Elastic Load Balancing load balancer.

SchedulingStrategy.documentation:
The scheduling strategy to use for the service.

The REPLICA scheduling strategy places and maintains the desired number of tasks across the cluster. By default, the service scheduler spreads tasks across Availability Zones. Task placement strategies and constraints are used to customize task placement decisions.

The DAEMON scheduling strategy deploys exactly one task on each active container instance that meets all of the task placement constraints that are specified in the cluster. The service scheduler also evaluates the task placement constraints for running tasks and stops tasks that do not meet the placement constraints.

Valid values: REPLICA | DAEMON

ServiceName.documentation:
The name of the service.

The name can contain up to 255 characters. It can use letters, numbers, underscores, and hyphens.

ServiceRegistries.documentation: Information about the service discovery registries to assign to the service.

TaskDefinition.documentation: The task definition to use for tasks in the service.

AwsEcsServiceLoadBalancersDetails.documentation: Information about a load balancer that the service uses.

ContainerName.documentation: The name of the container to associate with the load balancer.

ContainerPort.documentation: The port on the container to associate with the load balancer. This port must correspond to a containerPort in the task definition the tasks in the service are using. For tasks that use the EC2 launch type, the container instance they are launched on must allow ingress traffic on the hostPort of the port mapping.

LoadBalancerName.documentation:
The name of the load balancer to associate with the Amazon ECS service or task set.

Only specified when using a Classic Load Balancer. For an Application Load Balancer or a Network Load Balancer, the load balancer name is omitted.

TargetGroupArn.documentation:
The ARN of the Elastic Load Balancing target group or groups associated with a service or task set.

Only specified when using an Application Load Balancer or a Network Load Balancer. For a Classic Load Balancer, the target group ARN is omitted.

AwsEcsServiceNetworkConfigurationAwsVpcC.documentation: For tasks that use the awsvpc networking mode, the VPC subnet and security group configuration.

AssignPublicIp.documentation:
Whether the task's elastic network interface receives a public IP address. The default value is DISABLED.

Valid values: ENABLED | DISABLED

SecurityGroups.documentation:
The IDs of the security groups associated with the task or service.

You can provide up to five security groups.

Subnets.documentation:
The IDs of the subnets associated with the task or service.

You can provide up to 16 subnets.

AwsEcsServiceNetworkConfigurationDetails.documentation: For tasks that use the awsvpc networking mode, the VPC subnet and security group configuration.

AwsVpcConfiguration.documentation: The VPC subnet and security group configuration.

AwsEcsServicePlacementConstraintsDetails.documentation: A placement constraint for the tasks in the service.

Expression.documentation: A cluster query language expression to apply to the constraint. You cannot specify an expression if the constraint type is distinctInstance.

Type.documentation:
The type of constraint. Use distinctInstance to run each task in a particular group on a different container instance. Use memberOf to restrict the selection to a group of valid candidates.

Valid values: distinctInstance | memberOf

AwsEcsServicePlacementStrategiesDetails.documentation: A placement strategy that determines how to place the tasks for the service.

Field.documentation:
The field to apply the placement strategy against.

For the spread placement strategy, valid values are instanceId (or host, which has the same effect), or any platform or custom attribute that is applied to a container instance, such as attribute:ecs.availability-zone.

For the binpack placement strategy, valid values are cpu and memory.

For the random placement strategy, this attribute is not used.

Type.documentation:
The type of placement strategy.

The random placement strategy randomly places tasks on available candidates.

The spread placement strategy spreads placement across available candidates evenly based on the value of Field.

The binpack strategy places tasks on available candidates that have the least available amount of the resource that is specified in Field.

Valid values: random | spread | binpack

AwsEcsServiceServiceRegistriesDetails.documentation: Information about a service discovery registry to assign to the service.

ContainerName.documentation:
The container name value to use for the service discovery service.

If the task definition uses the bridge or host network mode, you must specify ContainerName and ContainerPort.

If the task definition uses the awsvpc network mode and a type SRV DNS record, you must specify either ContainerName and ContainerPort, or Port , but not both.

ContainerPort.documentation:
The port value to use for the service discovery service.

If the task definition uses the bridge or host network mode, you must specify ContainerName and ContainerPort.

If the task definition uses the awsvpc network mode and a type SRV DNS record, you must specify either ContainerName and ContainerPort, or Port , but not both.

Port.documentation: The port value to use for a service discovery service that specifies an SRV record. This field can be used if both the awsvpcawsvpc network mode and SRV records are used.

AwsEcsTaskDefinitionContainerDefinitions.documentation: A dependency that is defined for container startup and shutdown.

Condition.documentation:
The dependency condition of the dependent container. Indicates the required status of the dependent container before the current container can start. Valid values are as follows:

  • COMPLETE

  • HEALTHY

  • SUCCESS

  • START

AwsEcsTaskDefinitionContainerDefinitions.documentation: A container definition that describes a container in the task.

Command.documentation: The command that is passed to the container.

Cpu.documentation: The number of CPU units reserved for the container.

DependsOn.documentation: The dependencies that are defined for container startup and shutdown.

DisableNetworking.documentation: Whether to disable networking within the container.

DnsSearchDomains.documentation: A list of DNS search domains that are presented to the container.

DnsServers.documentation: A list of DNS servers that are presented to the container.

DockerLabels.documentation: A key-value map of labels to add to the container.

DockerSecurityOptions.documentation: A list of strings to provide custom labels for SELinux and AppArmor multi-level security systems.

EntryPoint.documentation: The entry point that is passed to the container.

Environment.documentation: The environment variables to pass to a container.

EnvironmentFiles.documentation: A list of files containing the environment variables to pass to a container.

Essential.documentation: Whether the container is essential. All tasks must have at least one essential container.

ExtraHosts.documentation: A list of hostnames and IP address mappings to append to the /etc/hosts file on the container.

FirelensConfiguration.documentation: The FireLens configuration for the container. Specifies and configures a log router for container logs.

HealthCheck.documentation: The container health check command and associated configuration parameters for the container.

Hostname.documentation: The hostname to use for the container.

Image.documentation: The image used to start the container.

Interactive.documentation: If set to true, then containerized applications can be deployed that require stdin or a tty to be allocated.

Links.documentation: A list of links for the container in the form container_name:alias . Allows containers to communicate with each other without the need for port mappings.

LinuxParameters.documentation: Linux-specific modifications that are applied to the container, such as Linux kernel capabilities.

LogConfiguration.documentation: The log configuration specification for the container.

Memory.documentation: The amount (in MiB) of memory to present to the container. If the container attempts to exceed the memory specified here, the container is shut down. The total amount of memory reserved for all containers within a task must be lower than the task memory value, if one is specified.

MemoryReservation.documentation: The soft limit (in MiB) of memory to reserve for the container.

MountPoints.documentation: The mount points for the data volumes in the container.

PortMappings.documentation: The list of port mappings for the container.

Privileged.documentation: Whether the container is given elevated privileges on the host container instance. The elevated privileges are similar to the root user.

PseudoTerminal.documentation: Whether to allocate a TTY to the container.

ReadonlyRootFilesystem.documentation: Whether the container is given read-only access to its root file system.

RepositoryCredentials.documentation: The private repository authentication credentials to use.

ResourceRequirements.documentation: The type and amount of a resource to assign to a container. The only supported resource is a GPU.

Secrets.documentation: The secrets to pass to the container.

StartTimeout.documentation: The number of seconds to wait before giving up on resolving dependencies for a container.

StopTimeout.documentation: The number of seconds to wait before the container is stopped if it doesn't shut down normally on its own.

SystemControls.documentation: A list of namespaced kernel parameters to set in the container.

Ulimits.documentation: A list of ulimits to set in the container.

User.documentation:
The user to use inside the container.

The value can use one of the following formats.

  • user

  • user : group

  • uid

  • uid : gid

  • user : gid

  • uid : group

VolumesFrom.documentation: Data volumes to mount from another container.

WorkingDirectory.documentation: The working directory in which to run commands inside the container.

AwsEcsTaskDefinitionContainerDefinitions.documentation: An environment variable to pass to the container.
A file that contain environment variables to pass to a container.

Type.documentation: The type of environment file. The valid value is s3.

Value.documentation: The ARN of the S3 object that contains the environment variable file.

AwsEcsTaskDefinitionContainerDefinitions.documentation: A hostname and IP address mapping to append to the /etc/hosts file on the container.

Hostname.documentation: The hostname to use in the /etc/hosts entry.

IpAddress.documentation: The IP address to use in the /etc/hosts entry.

AwsEcsTaskDefinitionContainerDefinitions.documentation: The FireLens configuration for the container. The configuration specifies and configures a log router for container logs.

Options.documentation:
The options to use to configure the log router.

The valid option keys are as follows:

  • enable-ecs-log-metadata. The value can be true or false.

  • config-file-type. The value can be s3 or file.

  • config-file-value. The value is either an S3 ARN or a file path.

Type.documentation: The log router to use. Valid values are fluentbit or fluentd.

AwsEcsTaskDefinitionContainerDefinitions.documentation: The container health check command and associated configuration parameters for the container.

Command.documentation: The command that the container runs to determine whether it is healthy.

Interval.documentation: The time period in seconds between each health check execution. The default value is 30 seconds.

Retries.documentation: The number of times to retry a failed health check before the container is considered unhealthy. The default value is 3.

StartPeriod.documentation: The optional grace period in seconds that allows containers time to bootstrap before failed health checks count towards the maximum number of retries.

Timeout.documentation: The time period in seconds to wait for a health check to succeed before it is considered a failure. The default value is 5.

AwsEcsTaskDefinitionContainerDefinitions.documentation: The Linux capabilities for the container that are added to or dropped from the default configuration provided by Docker.

Add.documentation:
The Linux capabilities for the container that are added to the default configuration provided by Docker. Valid values are as follows:

Valid values: "ALL" | "AUDIT_CONTROL" | "AUDIT_WRITE" | "BLOCK_SUSPEND" | "CHOWN" | "DAC_OVERRIDE" | "DAC_READ_SEARCH" | "FOWNER" | "FSETID" | "IPC_LOCK" | "IPC_OWNER" | "KILL" | "LEASE" | "LINUX_IMMUTABLE" | "MAC_ADMIN" | "MAC_OVERRIDE" | "MKNOD" | "NET_ADMIN" | "NET_BIND_SERVICE" | "NET_BROADCAST" | "NET_RAW" | "SETFCAP" | "SETGID" | "SETPCAP" | "SETUID" | "SYS_ADMIN" | "SYS_BOOT" | "SYS_CHROOT" | "SYS_MODULE" | "SYS_NICE" | "SYS_PACCT" | "SYS_PTRACE" | "SYS_RAWIO" | "SYS_RESOURCE" | "SYS_TIME" | "SYS_TTY_CONFIG" | "SYSLOG" | "WAKE_ALARM"

Drop.documentation:
The Linux capabilities for the container that are dropped from the default configuration provided by Docker.

Valid values: "ALL" | "AUDIT_CONTROL" | "AUDIT_WRITE" | "BLOCK_SUSPEND" | "CHOWN" | "DAC_OVERRIDE" | "DAC_READ_SEARCH" | "FOWNER" | "FSETID" | "IPC_LOCK" | "IPC_OWNER" | "KILL" | "LEASE" | "LINUX_IMMUTABLE" | "MAC_ADMIN" | "MAC_OVERRIDE" | "MKNOD" | "NET_ADMIN" | "NET_BIND_SERVICE" | "NET_BROADCAST" | "NET_RAW" | "SETFCAP" | "SETGID" | "SETPCAP" | "SETUID" | "SYS_ADMIN" | "SYS_BOOT" | "SYS_CHROOT" | "SYS_MODULE" | "SYS_NICE" | "SYS_PACCT" | "SYS_PTRACE" | "SYS_RAWIO" | "SYS_RESOURCE" | "SYS_TIME" | "SYS_TTY_CONFIG" | "SYSLOG" | "WAKE_ALARM"

AwsEcsTaskDefinitionContainerDefinitions.documentation: >Linux-specific modifications that are applied to the container, such as Linux kernel capabilities.

Capabilities.documentation: The Linux capabilities for the container that are added to or dropped from the default configuration provided by Docker.

Devices.documentation: The host devices to expose to the container.

InitProcessEnabled.documentation: Whether to run an init process inside the container that forwards signals and reaps processes.

MaxSwap.documentation: The total amount of swap memory (in MiB) that a container can use.

SharedMemorySize.documentation: The value for the size (in MiB) of the /dev/shm volume.

Swappiness.documentation: Configures the container's memory swappiness behavior. Determines how aggressively pages are swapped. The higher the value, the more aggressive the swappiness. The default is 60.

Tmpfs.documentation: The container path, mount options, and size (in MiB) of the tmpfs mount.

AwsEcsTaskDefinitionContainerDefinitions.documentation: A host device to expose to the container.

ContainerPath.documentation: The path inside the container at which to expose the host device.

HostPath.documentation: The path for the device on the host container instance.

Permissions.documentation: The explicit permissions to provide to the container for the device. By default, the container has permissions for read, write, and mknod for the device.

AwsEcsTaskDefinitionContainerDefinitions.documentation: The container path, mount options, and size (in MiB) of a tmpfs mount.

ContainerPath.documentation: The absolute file path where the tmpfs volume is to be mounted.

MountOptions.documentation:
The list of tmpfs volume mount options.

Valid values: "defaults" | "ro" | "rw" | "suid" | "nosuid" | "dev" | "nodev" | "exec" | "noexec" | "sync" | "async" | "dirsync" | "remount" | "mand" | "nomand" | "atime" | "noatime" | "diratime" | "nodiratime" | "bind" | "rbind" | "unbindable" | "runbindable" | "private" | "rprivate" | "shared" | "rshared" | "slave" | "rslave" | "relatime" | "norelatime" | "strictatime" | "nostrictatime" | "mode" | "uid" | "gid" | "nr_inodes" | "nr_blocks" | "mpol"

Size.documentation: The maximum size (in MiB) of the tmpfs volume.

AwsEcsTaskDefinitionContainerDefinitions.documentation: The log configuration specification for the container.

LogDriver.documentation:
The log driver to use for the container.

Valid values on Fargate are as follows:

  • awsfirelens

  • awslogs

  • splunk

Valid values on Amazon EC2 are as follows:

  • awsfirelens

  • awslogs

  • fluentd

  • gelf

  • journald

  • json-file

  • logentries

  • splunk

  • syslog

Options.documentation: The configuration options to send to the log driver. Requires version 1.19 of the Docker Remote API or greater on your container instance.

SecretOptions.documentation: The secrets to pass to the log configuration.

AwsEcsTaskDefinitionContainerDefinitions.documentation: A secret to pass to the log configuration.

ValueFrom.documentation:
The secret to expose to the container.

The value is either the full ARN of the Secrets Manager secret or the full ARN of the parameter in the Systems Manager Parameter Store.

AwsEcsTaskDefinitionContainerDefinitions.documentation: A mount point for the data volumes in the container.

ContainerPath.documentation: The path on the container to mount the host volume at.

ReadOnly.documentation: Whether the container has read-only access to the volume.

SourceVolume.documentation: The name of the volume to mount. Must match the name of a volume listed in VolumeDetails for the task definition.

AwsEcsTaskDefinitionContainerDefinitions.documentation: A port mapping for the container.

ContainerPort.documentation: The port number on the container that is bound to the user-specified or automatically assigned host port.

HostPort.documentation: The port number on the container instance to reserve for the container.

Protocol.documentation: The protocol used for the port mapping. The default is tcp.

AwsEcsTaskDefinitionContainerDefinitions.documentation: The private repository authentication credentials to use.

CredentialsParameter.documentation: The ARN of the secret that contains the private repository credentials.

AwsEcsTaskDefinitionContainerDefinitions.documentation: A resource to assign to a container.

Type.documentation: The type of resource to assign to a container. Valid values are GPU or InferenceAccelerator.

Value.documentation:
The value for the specified resource type.

For GPU, the value is the number of physical GPUs the Amazon ECS container agent reserves for the container.

For InferenceAccelerator, the value should match the DeviceName attribute of an entry in InferenceAccelerators.

AwsEcsTaskDefinitionContainerDefinitions.documentation: A secret to pass to the container.

ValueFrom.documentation: The secret to expose to the container. The value is either the full ARN of the Secrets Manager secret or the full ARN of the parameter in the Systems Manager Parameter Store.

AwsEcsTaskDefinitionContainerDefinitions.documentation: A namespaced kernel parameter to set in the container.

Namespace.documentation: The namespaced kernel parameter for which to set a value.

AwsEcsTaskDefinitionContainerDefinitions.documentation: A ulimit to set in the container.

HardLimit.documentation: The hard limit for the ulimit type.

Name.documentation:
The type of the ulimit. Valid values are as follows:

  • core

  • cpu

  • data

  • fsize

  • locks

  • memlock

  • msgqueue

  • nice

  • nofile

  • nproc

  • rss

  • rtprio

  • rttime

  • sigpending

  • stack

SoftLimit.documentation: The soft limit for the ulimit type.

AwsEcsTaskDefinitionContainerDefinitions.documentation: A data volume to mount from another container.

ReadOnly.documentation: Whether the container has read-only access to the volume.

SourceContainer.documentation: The name of another container within the same task definition from which to mount volumes.

AwsEcsTaskDefinitionDetails.documentation: Details about a task definition. A task definition describes the container and volume definitions of an Amazon Elastic Container Service task.

ContainerDefinitions.documentation: The container definitions that describe the containers that make up the task.

Cpu.documentation:
The number of CPU units used by the task.Valid values are as follows:

  • 256 (.25 vCPU)

  • 512 (.5 vCPU)

  • 1024 (1 vCPU)

  • 2048 (2 vCPU)

  • 4096 (4 vCPU)

ExecutionRoleArn.documentation: The ARN of the task execution role that grants the container agent permission to make API calls on behalf of the container user.

Family.documentation: The name of a family that this task definition is registered to.

InferenceAccelerators.documentation: The Elastic Inference accelerators to use for the containers in the task.

IpcMode.documentation:
The inter-process communication (IPC) resource namespace to use for the containers in the task. Valid values are as follows:

  • host

  • none

  • task

Memory.documentation:
The amount (in MiB) of memory used by the task.

For tasks that are hosted on Amazon EC2, you can provide a task-level memory value or a container-level memory value. For tasks that are hosted on Fargate, you must use one of the specified values in the Amazon Elastic Container Service Developer Guide , which determines your range of supported values for the Cpu and Memory parameters.

NetworkMode.documentation:
The Docker networking mode to use for the containers in the task. Valid values are as follows:

  • awsvpc

  • bridge

  • host

  • none

PidMode.documentation: The process namespace to use for the containers in the task. Valid values are host or task.

PlacementConstraints.documentation: The placement constraint objects to use for tasks.

ProxyConfiguration.documentation: The configuration details for the App Mesh proxy.

RequiresCompatibilities.documentation: The task launch types that the task definition was validated against.

TaskRoleArn.documentation: The short name or ARN of the IAM role that grants containers in the task permission to call Amazon Web Services API operations on your behalf.

Volumes.documentation: The data volume definitions for the task.

AwsEcsTaskDefinitionInferenceAccelerator.documentation: An Elastic Inference accelerator to use for the containers in the task.

DeviceType.documentation: The Elastic Inference accelerator type to use.

AwsEcsTaskDefinitionPlacementConstraints.documentation: A placement constraint object to use for tasks.

Expression.documentation: A cluster query language expression to apply to the constraint.

Type.documentation: The type of constraint.

AwsEcsTaskDefinitionProxyConfigurationDe.documentation: The configuration details for the App Mesh proxy.

ContainerName.documentation: The name of the container that will serve as the App Mesh proxy.

ProxyConfigurationProperties.documentation: The set of network configuration parameters to provide to the Container Network Interface (CNI) plugin, specified as key-value pairs.

Type.documentation: The proxy type.

AwsEcsTaskDefinitionProxyConfigurationPr.documentation: A network configuration parameter to provide to the Container Network Interface (CNI) plugin.

AwsEcsTaskDefinitionVolumesDetails.documentation: A data volume to mount from another container.

EfsVolumeConfiguration.documentation: Information about the Amazon Elastic File System file system that is used for task storage.

Host.documentation: Information about a bind mount host volume.

Autoprovision.documentation: Whether to create the Docker volume automatically if it does not already exist.

DriverOpts.documentation: A map of Docker driver-specific options that are passed through.

Labels.documentation: Custom metadata to add to the Docker volume.

Scope.documentation: The scope for the Docker volume that determines its lifecycle. Docker volumes that are scoped to a task are provisioned automatically when the task starts and destroyed when the task stops. Docker volumes that are shared persist after the task stops. Valid values are shared or task.

AccessPointId.documentation: The Amazon EFS access point identifier to use.

Iam.documentation: Whether to use the Amazon ECS task IAM role defined in a task definition when mounting the Amazon EFS file system.

AwsEcsTaskDefinitionVolumesEfsVolumeConf.documentation: Information about the Amazon Elastic File System file system that is used for task storage.

AuthorizationConfig.documentation: The authorization configuration details for the Amazon EFS file system.

FilesystemId.documentation: The Amazon EFS file system identifier to use.

RootDirectory.documentation: The directory within the Amazon EFS file system to mount as the root directory inside the host.

TransitEncryption.documentation: Whether to enable encryption for Amazon EFS data in transit between the Amazon ECS host and the Amazon EFS server.

TransitEncryptionPort.documentation: The port to use when sending encrypted data between the Amazon ECS host and the Amazon EFS server.

AwsEcsTaskDefinitionVolumesHostDetails.documentation: Information about a bind mount host volume.

SourcePath.documentation: The path on the host container instance that is presented to the container.

AwsEcsTaskDetails.documentation: Provides details about a task in a cluster.

ClusterArn.documentation: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the cluster that hosts the task.

Containers.documentation: The containers that are associated with the task.

CreatedAt.documentation: The Unix timestamp for the time when the task was created. More specifically, it's for the time when the task entered the PENDING state.

Group.documentation: The name of the task group that's associated with the task.

StartedAt.documentation: The Unix timestamp for the time when the task started. More specifically, it's for the time when the task transitioned from the PENDING state to the RUNNING state.

StartedBy.documentation: The tag specified when a task is started. If an Amazon ECS service started the task, the startedBy parameter contains the deployment ID of that service.

TaskDefinitionArn.documentation: The ARN of the task definition that creates the task.

Volumes.documentation: Details about the data volume that is used in a task definition.

AwsEcsTaskVolumeDetails.documentation: Provides information about a data volume that's used in a task definition.

Host.documentation: This parameter is specified when you use bind mount host volumes. The contents of the host parameter determine whether your bind mount host volume persists on the host container instance and where it's stored.

Name.documentation: The name of the volume. Up to 255 letters (uppercase and lowercase), numbers, underscores, and hyphens are allowed. This name is referenced in the sourceVolume parameter of container definition mountPoints.

AwsEcsTaskVolumeHostDetails.documentation: Provides details on a container instance bind mount host volume.

SourcePath.documentation: When the host parameter is used, specify a sourcePath to declare the path on the host container instance that's presented to the container.

AwsEfsAccessPointDetails.documentation: Provides information about an Amazon EFS access point.

AccessPointId.documentation: The ID of the Amazon EFS access point.

Arn.documentation: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the Amazon EFS access point.

ClientToken.documentation: The opaque string specified in the request to ensure idempotent creation.

FileSystemId.documentation: The ID of the Amazon EFS file system that the access point applies to.

PosixUser.documentation: The full POSIX identity, including the user ID, group ID, and secondary group IDs on the access point, that is used for all file operations by NFS clients using the access point.

RootDirectory.documentation: The directory on the Amazon EFS file system that the access point exposes as the root directory to NFS clients using the access point.

AwsEfsAccessPointPosixUserDetails.documentation: Provides details for all file system operations using this Amazon EFS access point.

Gid.documentation: The POSIX group ID used for all file system operations using this access point.

SecondaryGids.documentation: Secondary POSIX group IDs used for all file system operations using this access point.

Uid.documentation: The POSIX user ID used for all file system operations using this access point.

AwsEfsAccessPointRootDirectoryCreationIn.documentation: Provides information about the settings that Amazon EFS uses to create the root directory when a client connects to an access point.

OwnerGid.documentation: Specifies the POSIX group ID to apply to the root directory.

OwnerUid.documentation: Specifies the POSIX user ID to apply to the root directory.

Permissions.documentation: Specifies the POSIX permissions to apply to the root directory, in the format of an octal number representing the file's mode bits.

AwsEfsAccessPointRootDirectoryDetails.documentation: Provides information about the directory on the Amazon EFS file system that the access point exposes as the root directory to NFS clients using the access point.

CreationInfo.documentation: Specifies the POSIX IDs and permissions to apply to the access point's root directory.

Path.documentation: Specifies the path on the Amazon EFS file system to expose as the root directory to NFS clients using the access point to access the EFS file system. A path can have up to four subdirectories. If the specified path does not exist, you are required to provide CreationInfo.

AwsEksClusterDetails.documentation: Provides details about an Amazon EKS cluster.

CertificateAuthorityData.documentation: The certificate authority data for the cluster.

ClusterStatus.documentation:
The status of the cluster. Valid values are as follows:

  • ACTIVE

  • CREATING

  • DELETING

  • FAILED

  • PENDING

  • UPDATING

Endpoint.documentation: The endpoint for the Amazon EKS API server.

ResourcesVpcConfig.documentation: The VPC configuration used by the cluster control plane.

RoleArn.documentation: The ARN of the IAM role that provides permissions for the Amazon EKS control plane to make calls to Amazon Web Services API operations on your behalf.

Version.documentation: The Amazon EKS server version for the cluster.

Enabled.documentation: Whether the logging types that are listed in Types are enabled.

Types.documentation:
A list of logging types. Valid values are as follows:

  • api

  • audit

  • authenticator

  • controllerManager

  • scheduler

AwsEksClusterLoggingDetails.documentation: The logging configuration for an Amazon EKS cluster.

AwsEksClusterResourcesVpcConfigDetails.documentation: Information about the VPC configuration used by the cluster control plane.

SecurityGroupIds.documentation: The security groups that are associated with the cross-account elastic network interfaces that are used to allow communication between your nodes and the Amazon EKS control plane.

SubnetIds.documentation: The subnets that are associated with the cluster.

AwsElasticBeanstalkEnvironmentDetails.documentation: Contains details about an Elastic Beanstalk environment.

ApplicationName.documentation: The name of the application that is associated with the environment.

Cname.documentation: The URL to the CNAME for this environment.

DateUpdated.documentation: The date when this environment was last modified.

EndpointUrl.documentation: For load-balanced, autoscaling environments, the URL to the load balancer. For single-instance environments, the IP address of the instance.

EnvironmentLinks.documentation: Links to other environments in the same group.

PlatformArn.documentation: The ARN of the platform version for the environment.

SolutionStackName.documentation: The name of the solution stack that is deployed with the environment.

Status.documentation:
The current operational status of the environment. Valid values are as follows:

  • Aborting

  • Launching

  • LinkingFrom

  • LinkingTo

  • Ready

  • Terminated

  • Terminating

  • Updating

AwsElasticBeanstalkEnvironmentEnvironmen.documentation: Contains information about a link to another environment that is in the same group.

AwsElasticBeanstalkEnvironmentOptionSett.documentation: A configuration option setting for the environment.

Namespace.documentation: The type of resource that the configuration option is associated with.

AwsElasticBeanstalkEnvironmentTier.documentation: Contains information about the tier of the environment.

Name.documentation: The name of the environment tier. Valid values are WebServer or Worker.

Type.documentation: The type of environment tier. Valid values are Standard or SQS/HTTP.

AccessPolicies.documentation: IAM policy document specifying the access policies for the new Elasticsearch domain.

DomainName.documentation:
Name of an Elasticsearch domain.
