DestinationBucketName.documentation: The name of the S3 bucket where log files for the S3 bucket are stored.

LogFilePrefix.documentation: The prefix added to log files for the S3 bucket.

AwsS3BucketNotificationConfiguration.documentation: The notification configuration for the S3 bucket.

AwsS3BucketNotificationConfigurationDeta.documentation: Details for an S3 bucket notification configuration.

Destination.documentation: The ARN of the Lambda function, Amazon SQS queue, or Amazon SNS topic that generates the notification.

Events.documentation: The list of events that trigger a notification.

Filter.documentation: The filters that determine which S3 buckets generate notifications.

Type.documentation:
Indicates the type of notification. Notifications can be generated using Lambda functions, Amazon SQS queues, or Amazon SNS topics, with corresponding valid values as follows:

  • LambdaConfiguration

  • QueueConfiguration

  • TopicConfiguration

AwsS3BucketNotificationConfigurationFilt.documentation: Filtering information for the notifications. The filtering is based on Amazon S3 key names.

Name.documentation: Indicates whether the filter is based on the prefix or suffix of the Amazon S3 key.

AwsS3BucketServerSideEncryptionByDefault.documentation: Specifies the default server-side encryption to apply to new objects in the bucket.

KMSMasterKeyID.documentation: KMS key ID to use for the default encryption.

SSEAlgorithm.documentation: Server-side encryption algorithm to use for the default encryption. Valid values are aws: kms or AES256.

AwsS3BucketServerSideEncryptionConfigura.documentation: The encryption configuration for the S3 bucket.

Rules.documentation: The encryption rules that are applied to the S3 bucket.

AwsS3BucketServerSideEncryptionRule.documentation: An encryption rule to apply to the S3 bucket.

ApplyServerSideEncryptionByDefault.documentation: Specifies the default server-side encryption to apply to new objects in the bucket. If a PUT object request doesn't specify any server-side encryption, this default encryption is applied.

ErrorDocument.documentation: The name of the error document for the website.

IndexDocumentSuffix.documentation: The name of the index document for the website.

RedirectAllRequestsTo.documentation: The redirect behavior for requests to the website.

RoutingRules.documentation: The rules for applying redirects for requests to the website.

AwsS3BucketWebsiteConfigurationRedirectT.documentation: The redirect behavior for requests to the website.

Hostname.documentation: The name of the host to redirect requests to.

Protocol.documentation: The protocol to use when redirecting requests. By default, this field uses the same protocol as the original request. Valid values are http or https.

AwsS3BucketWebsiteConfigurationRoutingRu.documentation: A rule for redirecting requests to the website.

Condition.documentation: Provides the condition that must be met in order to apply the routing rule.

Redirect.documentation: Provides the rules to redirect the request if the condition in Condition is met.

AwsS3BucketWebsiteConfigurationRoutingRu.documentation: The condition that must be met in order to apply the routing rule.

HttpErrorCodeReturnedEquals.documentation: Indicates to redirect the request if the HTTP error code matches this value.

KeyPrefixEquals.documentation: Indicates to redirect the request if the key prefix matches this value.

AwsS3BucketWebsiteConfigurationRoutingRu.documentation: The rules to redirect the request if the condition in Condition is met.

Hostname.documentation: The host name to use in the redirect request.

HttpRedirectCode.documentation: The HTTP redirect code to use in the response.

Protocol.documentation: The protocol to use to redirect the request. By default, uses the protocol from the original request.

ReplaceKeyPrefixWith.documentation:
The object key prefix to use in the redirect request.

Cannot be provided if ReplaceKeyWith is present.

ReplaceKeyWith.documentation:
The specific object key to use in the redirect request.

Cannot be provided if ReplaceKeyPrefixWith is present.

ContentType.documentation: A standard MIME type describing the format of the object data.

ETag.documentation: The opaque identifier assigned by a web server to a specific version of a resource found at a URL.

LastModified.documentation:
Indicates when the object was last modified.

Uses the date-time format specified in RFC 3339 section 5.6, Internet Date/Time Format. The value cannot contain spaces. For example, 2020-03-22T13:22:13.933Z.

SSEKMSKeyId.documentation: The identifier of the KMS symmetric customer managed key that was used for the object.

ServerSideEncryption.documentation: If the object is stored using server-side encryption, the value of the server-side encryption algorithm used when storing this object in Amazon S3.

KmsKeyId.documentation: The ARN, Key ID, or alias of the KMS key used to encrypt the SecretString or SecretBinary values for versions of this secret.

RotationLambdaArn.documentation: The ARN of the Lambda function that rotates the secret.

RotationOccurredWithinFrequency.documentation: Whether the rotation occurred within the specified rotation frequency.

RotationRules.documentation: Defines the rotation schedule for the secret.

AwsSecretsManagerSecretRotationRules.documentation: Defines the rotation schedule for the secret.

AutomaticallyAfterDays.documentation: The number of days after the previous rotation to rotate the secret.

AwsSecurityFinding.documentation:
Provides a consistent format for Security Hub findings. AwsSecurityFinding format allows you to share findings between Amazon Web Services security services and third-party solutions.

A finding is a potential security issue generated either by Amazon Web Services services or by the integrated third-party solutions and standards checks.

Action.documentation: Provides details about an action that affects or that was taken on a resource.

AwsAccountId.documentation: The Amazon Web Services account ID that a finding is generated in.

CompanyName.documentation:
The name of the company for the product that generated the finding.

Security Hub populates this attribute automatically for each finding. You cannot update this attribute with BatchImportFindings or BatchUpdateFindings. The exception to this is a custom integration.

When you use the Security Hub console or API to filter findings by company name, you use this attribute.

Compliance.documentation: This data type is exclusive to findings that are generated as the result of a check run against a specific rule in a supported security standard, such as CIS Amazon Web Services Foundations. Contains security standard-related finding details.

Confidence.documentation:
A finding's confidence. Confidence is defined as the likelihood that a finding accurately identifies the behavior or issue that it was intended to identify.

Confidence is scored on a 0-100 basis using a ratio scale, where 0 means zero percent confidence and 100 means 100 percent confidence.

CreatedAt.documentation:
Indicates when the security-findings provider created the potential security issue that a finding captured.

Uses the date-time format specified in RFC 3339 section 5.6, Internet Date/Time Format. The value cannot contain spaces. For example, 2020-03-22T13:22:13.933Z.

Criticality.documentation:
The level of importance assigned to the resources associated with the finding.

A score of 0 means that the underlying resources have no criticality, and a score of 100 is reserved for the most critical resources.

Description.documentation:
A finding's description.

In this release, Description is a required property.

FindingProviderFields.documentation: In a BatchImportFindings request, finding providers use FindingProviderFields to provide and update their own values for confidence, criticality, related findings, severity, and types.

FirstObservedAt.documentation:
Indicates when the security-findings provider first observed the potential security issue that a finding captured.

Uses the date-time format specified in RFC 3339 section 5.6, Internet Date/Time Format. The value cannot contain spaces. For example, 2020-03-22T13:22:13.933Z.

GeneratorId.documentation: The identifier for the solution-specific component (a discrete unit of logic) that generated a finding. In various security-findings providers' solutions, this generator can be called a rule, a check, a detector, a plugin, etc.

Id.documentation: The security findings provider-specific identifier for a finding.

LastObservedAt.documentation:
Indicates when the security-findings provider most recently observed the potential security issue that a finding captured.

Uses the date-time format specified in RFC 3339 section 5.6, Internet Date/Time Format. The value cannot contain spaces. For example, 2020-03-22T13:22:13.933Z.

Malware.documentation: A list of malware related to a finding.

Network.documentation: The details of network-related information about a finding.

NetworkPath.documentation: Provides information about a network path that is relevant to a finding. Each entry under NetworkPath represents a component of that path.

Note.documentation: A user-defined note added to a finding.

PatchSummary.documentation: Provides an overview of the patch compliance status for an instance against a selected compliance standard.

Process.documentation: The details of process-related information about a finding.

ProductArn.documentation: The ARN generated by Security Hub that uniquely identifies a product that generates findings. This can be the ARN for a third-party product that is integrated with Security Hub, or the ARN for a custom integration.

ProductFields.documentation:
A data type where security-findings providers can include additional solution-specific details that aren't part of the defined AwsSecurityFinding format.

Can contain up to 50 key-value pairs. For each key-value pair, the key can contain up to 128 characters, and the value can contain up to 2048 characters.

ProductName.documentation:
The name of the product that generated the finding.

Security Hub populates this attribute automatically for each finding. You cannot update this attribute with BatchImportFindings or BatchUpdateFindings. The exception to this is a custom integration.

When you use the Security Hub console or API to filter findings by product name, you use this attribute.

Region.documentation:
The Region from which the finding was generated.

Security Hub populates this attribute automatically for each finding. You cannot update it using BatchImportFindings or BatchUpdateFindings.

Remediation.documentation: A data type that describes the remediation options for a finding.

Resources.documentation: A set of resource data types that describe the resources that the finding refers to.

Sample.documentation: Indicates whether the finding is a sample finding.

SchemaVersion.documentation: The schema version that a finding is formatted for.

SourceUrl.documentation: A URL that links to a page about the current finding in the security-findings provider's solution.

ThreatIntelIndicators.documentation: Threat intelligence details related to a finding.

Threats.documentation: Details about the threat detected in a security finding and the file paths that were affected by the threat.

Title.documentation:
A finding's title.

In this release, Title is a required property.

Types.documentation:
One or more finding types in the format of namespace/category/classifier that classify a finding.

Valid namespace values are: Software and Configuration Checks | TTPs | Effects | Unusual Behaviors | Sensitive Data Identifications

UpdatedAt.documentation:
Indicates when the security-findings provider last updated the finding record.

Uses the date-time format specified in RFC 3339 section 5.6, Internet Date/Time Format. The value cannot contain spaces. For example, 2020-03-22T13:22:13.933Z.

UserDefinedFields.documentation: A list of name/value string pairs associated with the finding. These are custom, user-defined fields added to a finding.

Vulnerabilities.documentation: Provides a list of vulnerabilities associated with the findings.

Workflow.documentation: Provides information about the status of the investigation into a finding.

AwsSecurityFindingFilters.documentation:
A collection of attributes that are applied to all active Security Hub-aggregated findings and that result in a subset of findings that are included in this insight.

You can filter by up to 10 finding attributes. For each attribute, you can provide up to 20 filter values.

AwsAccountId.documentation: The Amazon Web Services account ID that a finding is generated in.

CompanyName.documentation: The name of the findings provider (company) that owns the solution (product) that generates findings.

ComplianceStatus.documentation: Exclusive to findings that are generated as the result of a check run against a specific rule in a supported standard, such as CIS Amazon Web Services Foundations. Contains security standard-related finding details.

Confidence.documentation:
A finding's confidence. Confidence is defined as the likelihood that a finding accurately identifies the behavior or issue that it was intended to identify.

Confidence is scored on a 0-100 basis using a ratio scale, where 0 means zero percent confidence and 100 means 100 percent confidence.

CreatedAt.documentation: An ISO8601-formatted timestamp that indicates when the security-findings provider captured the potential security issue that a finding captured.

Criticality.documentation:
The level of importance assigned to the resources associated with the finding.

A score of 0 means that the underlying resources have no criticality, and a score of 100 is reserved for the most critical resources.

FindingProviderFieldsConfidence.documentation:
The finding provider value for the finding confidence. Confidence is defined as the likelihood that a finding accurately identifies the behavior or issue that it was intended to identify.

Confidence is scored on a 0-100 basis using a ratio scale, where 0 means zero percent confidence and 100 means 100 percent confidence.

FindingProviderFieldsCriticality.documentation:
The finding provider value for the level of importance assigned to the resources associated with the findings.

A score of 0 means that the underlying resources have no criticality, and a score of 100 is reserved for the most critical resources.

FindingProviderFieldsRelatedFindingsId.documentation: The finding identifier of a related finding that is identified by the finding provider.

FindingProviderFieldsRelatedFindingsProd.documentation: The ARN of the solution that generated a related finding that is identified by the finding provider.

FindingProviderFieldsSeverityLabel.documentation: The finding provider value for the severity label.

FindingProviderFieldsSeverityOriginal.documentation: The finding provider's original value for the severity.

FindingProviderFieldsTypes.documentation:
One or more finding types that the finding provider assigned to the finding. Uses the format of namespace/category/classifier that classify a finding.

Valid namespace values are: Software and Configuration Checks | TTPs | Effects | Unusual Behaviors | Sensitive Data Identifications

FirstObservedAt.documentation: An ISO8601-formatted timestamp that indicates when the security-findings provider first observed the potential security issue that a finding captured.

GeneratorId.documentation: The identifier for the solution-specific component (a discrete unit of logic) that generated a finding. In various security-findings providers' solutions, this generator can be called a rule, a check, a detector, a plugin, etc.

Id.documentation: The security findings provider-specific identifier for a finding.

LastObservedAt.documentation: An ISO8601-formatted timestamp that indicates when the security-findings provider most recently observed the potential security issue that a finding captured.

MalwareName.documentation: The name of the malware that was observed.

MalwarePath.documentation: The filesystem path of the malware that was observed.

MalwareState.documentation: The state of the malware that was observed.

MalwareType.documentation: The type of the malware that was observed.

NetworkDestinationDomain.documentation: The destination domain of network-related information about a finding.

NetworkDestinationIpV4.documentation: The destination IPv4 address of network-related information about a finding.

NetworkDestinationIpV6.documentation: The destination IPv6 address of network-related information about a finding.

NetworkDestinationPort.documentation: The destination port of network-related information about a finding.

NetworkDirection.documentation: Indicates the direction of network traffic associated with a finding.

NetworkProtocol.documentation: The protocol of network-related information about a finding.

NetworkSourceDomain.documentation: The source domain of network-related information about a finding.

NetworkSourceIpV4.documentation: The source IPv4 address of network-related information about a finding.

NetworkSourceIpV6.documentation: The source IPv6 address of network-related information about a finding.

NetworkSourceMac.documentation: The source media access control (MAC) address of network-related information about a finding.

NetworkSourcePort.documentation: The source port of network-related information about a finding.

NoteUpdatedAt.documentation: The timestamp of when the note was updated.

ProcessLaunchedAt.documentation: The date/time that the process was launched.

ProcessTerminatedAt.documentation: The date/time that the process was terminated.

ProductArn.documentation: The ARN generated by Security Hub that uniquely identifies a third-party company (security findings provider) after this provider's product (solution that generates findings) is registered with Security Hub.

ProductFields.documentation: A data type where security-findings providers can include additional solution-specific details that aren't part of the defined AwsSecurityFinding format.

ProductName.documentation: The name of the solution (product) that generates findings.

RecommendationText.documentation: The recommendation of what to do about the issue described in a finding.

RecordState.documentation: The updated record state for the finding.

Region.documentation: The Region from which the finding was generated.

RelatedFindingsId.documentation: The solution-generated identifier for a related finding.

RelatedFindingsProductArn.documentation: The ARN of the solution that generated a related finding.

ResourceAwsEc2InstanceIamInstanceProfile.documentation: The IAM profile ARN of the instance.

ResourceAwsEc2InstanceImageId.documentation: The Amazon Machine Image (AMI) ID of the instance.

ResourceAwsEc2InstanceIpV4Addresses.documentation: The IPv4 addresses associated with the instance.

ResourceAwsEc2InstanceIpV6Addresses.documentation: The IPv6 addresses associated with the instance.

ResourceAwsEc2InstanceKeyName.documentation: The key name associated with the instance.

ResourceAwsEc2InstanceLaunchedAt.documentation: The date and time the instance was launched.

ResourceAwsEc2InstanceSubnetId.documentation: The identifier of the subnet that the instance was launched in.

ResourceAwsEc2InstanceVpcId.documentation: The identifier of the VPC that the instance was launched in.

ResourceAwsIamAccessKeyCreatedAt.documentation: The creation date/time of the IAM access key related to a finding.

ResourceAwsIamAccessKeyPrincipalName.documentation: The name of the principal that is associated with an IAM access key.

ResourceAwsIamAccessKeyStatus.documentation: The status of the IAM access key related to a finding.

ResourceAwsIamAccessKeyUserName.deprecatedMessage: This filter is deprecated. Instead, use ResourceAwsIamAccessKeyPrincipalName.
ResourceAwsIamAccessKeyUserName.documentation: The user associated with the IAM access key related to a finding.

ResourceAwsS3BucketOwnerId.documentation: The canonical user ID of the owner of the S3 bucket.

ResourceAwsS3BucketOwnerName.documentation: The display name of the owner of the S3 bucket.

ResourceContainerImageId.documentation: The identifier of the image related to a finding.

ResourceContainerImageName.documentation: The name of the image related to a finding.

ResourceContainerLaunchedAt.documentation: The date/time that the container was started.

ResourceContainerName.documentation: The name of the container related to a finding.

ResourceDetailsOther.documentation: The details of a resource that doesn't have a specific subfield for the resource type defined.

ResourceId.documentation: The canonical identifier for the given resource type.

ResourcePartition.documentation: The canonical Amazon Web Services partition name that the Region is assigned to.

ResourceRegion.documentation: The canonical Amazon Web Services external Region name where this resource is located.

ResourceTags.documentation: A list of Amazon Web Services tags associated with a resource at the time the finding was processed.

ResourceType.documentation: Specifies the type of the resource that details are provided for.

Sample.documentation: Indicates whether or not sample findings are included in the filter results.

SeverityNormalized.deprecatedMessage: This filter is deprecated. Instead, use SeverityLabel or FindingProviderFieldsSeverityLabel.

SeverityProduct.deprecatedMessage: This filter is deprecated. Instead, use FindingProviderSeverityOriginal.
SeverityProduct.documentation: The native severity as defined by the security-findings provider's solution that generated the finding.

SourceUrl.documentation: A URL that links to a page about the current finding in the security-findings provider's solution.

ThreatIntelIndicatorCategory.documentation: The category of a threat intelligence indicator.

ThreatIntelIndicatorLastObservedAt.documentation: The date/time of the last observation of a threat intelligence indicator.

ThreatIntelIndicatorSourceUrl.documentation: The URL for more details from the source of the threat intelligence.

ThreatIntelIndicatorType.documentation: The type of a threat intelligence indicator.

ThreatIntelIndicatorValue.documentation: The value of a threat intelligence indicator.

Type.documentation: A finding type in the format of namespace/category/classifier that classifies a finding.

UpdatedAt.documentation: An ISO8601-formatted timestamp that indicates when the security-findings provider last updated the finding record.

UserDefinedFields.documentation: A list of name/value string pairs associated with the finding. These are custom, user-defined fields added to a finding.

WorkflowState.documentation:
The workflow state of a finding.

Note that this field is deprecated. To search for a finding based on its workflow status, use WorkflowStatus.

WorkflowStatus.documentation:
The status of the investigation into a finding. Allowed values are the following.

  • NEW - The initial state of a finding, before it is reviewed.

    Security Hub also resets the workflow status from NOTIFIED or RESOLVED to NEW in the following cases:

    • RecordState changes from ARCHIVED to ACTIVE.

    • Compliance.Status changes from PASSED to either WARNING, FAILED, or NOT_AVAILABLE.

  • NOTIFIED - Indicates that the resource owner has been notified about the security issue. Used when the initial reviewer is not the resource owner, and needs intervention from the resource owner.

    If one of the following occurs, the workflow status is changed automatically from NOTIFIED to NEW:

    • RecordState changes from ARCHIVED to ACTIVE.

    • Compliance.Status changes from PASSED to FAILED, WARNING, or NOT_AVAILABLE.

  • SUPPRESSED - Indicates that you reviewed the finding and do not believe that any action is needed.

    The workflow status of a SUPPRESSED finding does not change if RecordState changes from ARCHIVED to ACTIVE.

  • RESOLVED - The finding was reviewed and remediated and is now considered resolved.

    The finding remains RESOLVED unless one of the following occurs:

    • RecordState changes from ARCHIVED to ACTIVE.

    • Compliance.Status changes from PASSED to FAILED, WARNING, or NOT_AVAILABLE.

    In those cases, the workflow status is automatically reset to NEW.

    For findings from controls, if Compliance.Status is PASSED, then Security Hub automatically sets the workflow status to RESOLVED.

Id.documentation: The identifier of the finding that was specified by the finding provider.

ProductArn.documentation: The ARN generated by Security Hub that uniquely identifies a product that generates findings. This can be the ARN for a third-party product that is integrated with Security Hub, or the ARN for a custom integration.

AwsSnsTopicDetails.documentation: Provides information about an Amazon SNS topic to which notifications can be published.

ApplicationSuccessFeedbackRoleArn.documentation: Indicates failed message delivery status for an Amazon SNS topic that is subscribed to a platform application endpoint.

FirehoseFailureFeedbackRoleArn.documentation: Indicates failed message delivery status for an Amazon SNS topic that is subscribed to an Amazon Kinesis Data Firehose endpoint.

FirehoseSuccessFeedbackRoleArn.documentation: Indicates successful message delivery status for an Amazon SNS topic that is subscribed to an Amazon Kinesis Data Firehose endpoint.

HttpFailureFeedbackRoleArn.documentation: Indicates failed message delivery status for an Amazon SNS topic that is subscribed to an HTTP endpoint.

HttpSuccessFeedbackRoleArn.documentation: Indicates successful message delivery status for an Amazon SNS topic that is subscribed to an HTTP endpoint.

KmsMasterKeyId.documentation: The ID of an Amazon Web Services managed key for Amazon SNS or a customer managed key.

SqsFailureFeedbackRoleArn.documentation: Indicates failed message delivery status for an Amazon SNS topic that is subscribed to an Amazon SQS endpoint.

SqsSuccessFeedbackRoleArn.documentation: Indicates successful message delivery status for an Amazon SNS topic that is subscribed to an Amazon SQS endpoint.

Subscription.documentation: Subscription is an embedded property that describes the subscription endpoints of an Amazon SNS topic.

TopicName.documentation: The name of the Amazon SNS topic.

AwsSnsTopicSubscription.documentation: A wrapper type for the attributes of an Amazon SNS subscription.

Endpoint.documentation: The subscription's endpoint (format depends on the protocol).

DeadLetterTargetArn.documentation: The ARN of the dead-letter queue to which Amazon SQS moves messages after the value of maxReceiveCount is exceeded.

KmsDataKeyReusePeriodSeconds.documentation: The length of time, in seconds, for which Amazon SQS can reuse a data key to encrypt or decrypt messages before calling KMS again.

KmsMasterKeyId.documentation: The ID of an Amazon Web Services managed key for Amazon SQS or a custom KMS key.

AwsSsmComplianceSummary.documentation: Provides the details about the compliance status for a patch.

ComplianceType.documentation: The type of resource for which the compliance was determined. For AwsSsmPatchCompliance, ComplianceType is Patch.

CompliantCriticalCount.documentation: For the patches that are compliant, the number that have a severity of CRITICAL.

CompliantHighCount.documentation: For the patches that are compliant, the number that have a severity of HIGH.

CompliantInformationalCount.documentation: For the patches that are compliant, the number that have a severity of INFORMATIONAL.

CompliantLowCount.documentation: For the patches that are compliant, the number that have a severity of LOW.

CompliantMediumCount.documentation: For the patches that are compliant, the number that have a severity of MEDIUM.

CompliantUnspecifiedCount.documentation: For the patches that are compliant, the number that have a severity of UNSPECIFIED.

ExecutionType.documentation: The type of execution that was used determine compliance.

NonCompliantCriticalCount.documentation: For the patch items that are noncompliant, the number of items that have a severity of CRITICAL.

NonCompliantHighCount.documentation: For the patches that are noncompliant, the number that have a severity of HIGH.

NonCompliantInformationalCount.documentation: For the patches that are noncompliant, the number that have a severity of INFORMATIONAL.

NonCompliantLowCount.documentation: For the patches that are noncompliant, the number that have a severity of LOW.

NonCompliantMediumCount.documentation: For the patches that are noncompliant, the number that have a severity of MEDIUM.

NonCompliantUnspecifiedCount.documentation: For the patches that are noncompliant, the number that have a severity of UNSPECIFIED.

OverallSeverity.documentation:
The highest severity for the patches. Valid values are as follows:

  • CRITICAL

  • HIGH

  • MEDIUM

  • LOW

  • INFORMATIONAL

  • UNSPECIFIED

PatchBaselineId.documentation: The identifier of the patch baseline. The patch baseline lists the patches that are approved for installation.

PatchGroup.documentation: The identifier of the patch group for which compliance was determined. A patch group uses tags to group EC2 instances that should have the same patch compliance.

Status.documentation:
The current patch compliance status. Valid values are as follows:

  • COMPLIANT

  • NON_COMPLIANT

  • UNSPECIFIED_DATA

AwsSsmPatch.documentation: Provides details about the compliance for a patch.

ComplianceSummary.documentation: The compliance status details for the patch.

AwsSsmPatchComplianceDetails.documentation: Provides information about the state of a patch on an instance based on the patch baseline that was used to patch the instance.

Patch.documentation: Information about the status of a patch.

AwsWafRateBasedRuleDetails.documentation: Details about a rate-based rule for global resources. A rate-based rule provides settings to indicate when to allow, block, or count a request. Rate-based rules include the number of requests that arrive over a specified period of time.

MatchPredicates.documentation: The predicates to include in the rate-based rule.

MetricName.documentation: The name of the metrics for the rate-based rule.

RateKey.documentation: The field that WAF uses to determine whether requests are likely arriving from single source and are subject to rate monitoring.

RateLimit.documentation: The maximum number of requests that have an identical value for the field specified in RateKey that are allowed within a five-minute period. If the number of requests exceeds RateLimit and the other predicates specified in the rule are met, WAF triggers the action for the rule.

RuleId.documentation: The unique identifier for the rate-based rule.

AwsWafRateBasedRuleMatchPredicate.documentation: A match predicate. A predicate might look for characteristics such as specific IP addresses, geographic locations, or sizes.

Negated.documentation:
If set to true, then the rule actions are performed on requests that match the predicate settings.

If set to false, then the rule actions are performed on all requests except those that match the predicate settings.

Type.documentation:
The type of predicate. Valid values are as follows:

  • ByteMatch

  • GeoMatch

  • IPMatch

  • RegexMatch

  • SizeConstraint

  • SqlInjectionMatch

  • XssMatch

AwsWafRegionalRateBasedRuleDetails.documentation: contains details about a rate-based rule for Regional resources. A rate-based rule provides settings to indicate when to allow, block, or count a request. Rate-based rules include the number of requests that arrive over a specified period of time.

MatchPredicates.documentation: The predicates to include in the rate-based rule.

MetricName.documentation: The name of the metrics for the rate-based rule.

RateKey.documentation: The field that WAF uses to determine whether requests are likely arriving from single source and are subject to rate monitoring.

RateLimit.documentation: The maximum number of requests that have an identical value for the field specified in RateKey that are allowed within a five-minute period. If the number of requests exceeds RateLimit and the other predicates specified in the rule are met, WAF triggers the action for the rule.

RuleId.documentation: The unique identifier for the rate-based rule.

AwsWafRegionalRateBasedRuleMatchPredicat.documentation: Details for a match predicate. A predicate might look for characteristics such as specific IP addresses, geographic locations, or sizes.

Negated.documentation:
If set to true, then the rule actions are performed on requests that match the predicate settings.

If set to false, then the rule actions are performed on all requests except those that match the predicate settings.

Type.documentation:
The type of predicate. Valid values are as follows:

  • ByteMatch

  • GeoMatch

  • IPMatch

  • RegexMatch

  • SizeConstraint

  • SqlInjectionMatch

  • XssMatch

AwsWafRegionalRuleDetails.documentation: Provides information about an WAF Regional rule. This rule identifies the web requests that you want to allow, block, or count.

MetricName.documentation: A name for the metrics for the rule.

PredicateList.documentation: Specifies the ByteMatchSet, IPSet, SqlInjectionMatchSet, XssMatchSet, RegexMatchSet, GeoMatchSet, and SizeConstraintSet objects that you want to add to a rule and, for each object, indicates whether you want to negate the settings.

AwsWafRegionalRuleGroupDetails.documentation: Provides information about an WAF Regional rule group. The rule group is a collection of rules for inspecting and controlling web requests.

MetricName.documentation: A name for the metrics for this rule group.

Name.documentation: The descriptive name of the rule group.

Rules.documentation: Provides information about the rule statements used to identify the web requests that you want to allow, block, or count.

AwsWafRegionalRuleGroupRulesActionDetail.documentation: Describes the action that WAF should take on a web request when it matches the criteria defined in the rule.

Type.documentation: Specifies the ByteMatchSet, IPSet, SqlInjectionMatchSet, XssMatchSet, RegexMatchSet, GeoMatchSet, and SizeConstraintSet objects that you want to add to a rule and, for each object, indicates whether you want to negate the settings.

AwsWafRegionalRuleGroupRulesDetails.documentation: Provides information about the rules attached to a rule group

Action.documentation: The action that WAF should take on a web request when it matches the criteria defined in the rule.

Priority.documentation: If you define more than one rule in a web ACL, WAF evaluates each request against the rules in order based on the value of Priority.

Type.documentation: The type of rule in the rule group.

AwsWafRegionalRulePredicateListDetails.documentation: Provides details about the ByteMatchSet, IPSet, SqlInjectionMatchSet, XssMatchSet, RegexMatchSet, GeoMatchSet, and SizeConstraintSet objects that you want to add to a rule and, for each object, indicates whether you want to negate the settings.

DataId.documentation: A unique identifier for a predicate in a rule, such as ByteMatchSetId or IPSetId.

Negated.documentation: Specifies if you want WAF to allow, block, or count requests based on the settings in the ByteMatchSet, IPSet, SqlInjectionMatchSet, XssMatchSet, RegexMatchSet, GeoMatchSet, or SizeConstraintSet.

Type.documentation: The type of predicate in a rule, such as ByteMatch or IPSet.

AwsWafRegionalWebAclDetails.documentation: Provides information about the web access control list (web ACL). The web ACL contains the rules that identify the requests that you want to allow, block, or count.

DefaultAction.documentation: The action to perform if none of the rules contained in the web ACL match.

MetricName.documentation: A name for the metrics for this web ACL.

Name.documentation: A descriptive name for the web ACL.

RulesList.documentation: An array that contains the action for each rule in a web ACL, the priority of the rule, and the ID of the rule.

AwsWafRegionalWebAclRulesListActionDetai.documentation: The action that WAF takes when a web request matches all conditions in the rule, such as allow, block, or count the request.

Type.documentation: For actions that are associated with a rule, the action that WAF takes when a web request matches all conditions in a rule.

AwsWafRegionalWebAclRulesListDetails.documentation: A combination of ByteMatchSet, IPSet, and/or SqlInjectionMatchSet objects that identify the web requests that you want to allow, block, or count.

Action.documentation: The action that WAF takes when a web request matches all conditions in the rule, such as allow, block, or count the request.

OverrideAction.documentation: Overrides the rule evaluation result in the rule group.

Priority.documentation: The order in which WAF evaluates the rules in a web ACL.

RuleId.documentation: The ID of an WAF Regional rule to associate with a web ACL.

Type.documentation: For actions that are associated with a rule, the action that WAF takes when a web request matches all conditions in a rule.

AwsWafRegionalWebAclRulesListOverrideAct.documentation: Provides details about the action to use in the place of the action that results from the rule group evaluation.

Type.documentation: Overrides the rule evaluation result in the rule group.

AwsWafRuleDetails.documentation: Provides information about a WAF rule. This rule specifies the web requests that you want to allow, block, or count.

MetricName.documentation: The name of the metrics for this rule.

PredicateList.documentation: Specifies the ByteMatchSet, IPSet, SqlInjectionMatchSet, XssMatchSet, RegexMatchSet, GeoMatchSet, and SizeConstraintSet objects that you want to add to a rule and, for each object, indicates whether you want to negate the settings.

AwsWafRuleGroupDetails.documentation: Provides information about an WAF rule group. A rule group is a collection of rules for inspecting and controlling web requests.

MetricName.documentation: The name of the metrics for this rule group.

Rules.documentation: Provides information about the rules attached to the rule group. These rules identify the web requests that you want to allow, block, or count.

AwsWafRuleGroupRulesActionDetails.documentation: Provides information about what action WAF should take on a web request when it matches the criteria defined in the rule.

Type.documentation: The action that WAF should take on a web request when it matches the rule's statement.

AwsWafRuleGroupRulesDetails.documentation: Provides information about the rules attached to the rule group. These rules identify the web requests that you want to allow, block, or count.

Action.documentation: Provides information about what action WAF should take on a web request when it matches the criteria defined in the rule.

Priority.documentation: If you define more than one rule in a web ACL, WAF evaluates each request against the rules in order based on the value of Priority.

Type.documentation: The type of rule.

AwsWafRulePredicateListDetails.documentation: Provides details about the ByteMatchSet, IPSet, SqlInjectionMatchSet, XssMatchSet, RegexMatchSet, GeoMatchSet, and SizeConstraintSet objects that you want to add to a rule and, for each object, indicates whether you want to negate the settings.

DataId.documentation: A unique identifier for a predicate in a rule, such as ByteMatchSetId or IPSetId.

Negated.documentation: Specifies if you want WAF to allow, block, or count requests based on the settings in the ByteMatchSet, IPSet, SqlInjectionMatchSet, XssMatchSet, RegexMatchSet, GeoMatchSet, or SizeConstraintSet.

Type.documentation: The type of predicate in a rule, such as ByteMatch or IPSet.

AwsWafWebAclDetails.documentation: Provides information about an WAF web access control list (web ACL).

DefaultAction.documentation: The action to perform if none of the rules contained in the web ACL match.

Name.documentation: A friendly name or description of the web ACL. You can't change the name of a web ACL after you create it.

Rules.documentation: An array that contains the action for each rule in a web ACL, the priority of the rule, and the ID of the rule.

WebAclId.documentation: A unique identifier for a web ACL.

AwsWafWebAclRule.documentation: Details for a rule in an WAF web ACL.

Action.documentation: Specifies the action that CloudFront or WAF takes when a web request matches the conditions in the rule.

ExcludedRules.documentation: Rules to exclude from a rule group.

OverrideAction.documentation:
Use the OverrideAction to test your RuleGroup.

Any rule in a RuleGroup can potentially block a request. If you set the OverrideAction to None, the RuleGroup blocks a request if any individual rule in the RuleGroup matches the request and is configured to block that request.

However, if you first want to test the RuleGroup, set the OverrideAction to Count. The RuleGroup then overrides any block action specified by individual rules contained within the group. Instead of blocking matching requests, those requests are counted.

ActivatedRule|OverrideAction applies only when updating or adding a RuleGroup to a web ACL. In this case you do not use ActivatedRule Action. For all other update requests, ActivatedRule Action is used instead of ActivatedRule OverrideAction.

Priority.documentation: Specifies the order in which the rules in a web ACL are evaluated. Rules with a lower value for Priority are evaluated before rules with a higher value. The value must be a unique integer. If you add multiple rules to a web ACL, the values do not need to be consecutive.

Type.documentation:
The rule type.

Valid values: REGULAR | RATE_BASED | GROUP

The default is REGULAR.

AwsXrayEncryptionConfigDetails.documentation: Information about the encryption configuration for X-Ray.

KeyId.documentation: The identifier of the KMS key that is used for encryption. Provided if Type is KMS.

Status.documentation:
The current status of the encryption configuration. Valid values are ACTIVE or UPDATING.

When Status is equal to UPDATING, X-Ray might use both the old and new encryption.

Type.documentation: The type of encryption. KMS indicates that the encryption uses KMS keys. NONE indicates the default encryption.

StandardsSubscriptionArns.documentation: The ARNs of the standards subscriptions to disable.

StandardsSubscriptions.documentation: The details of the standards subscriptions that were disabled.

StandardsSubscriptionRequests.documentation: The list of standards checks to enable.

StandardsSubscriptions.documentation: The details of the standards subscriptions that were enabled.

Findings.documentation: A list of findings to import. To successfully import a finding, it must follow the Amazon Web Services Security Finding Format. Maximum of 100 findings per request.

FailedCount.documentation: The number of findings that failed to import.

FailedFindings.documentation: The list of findings that failed to import.

SuccessCount.documentation: The number of findings that were successfully imported.

Confidence.documentation:
The updated value for the finding confidence. Confidence is defined as the likelihood that a finding accurately identifies the behavior or issue that it was intended to identify.

Confidence is scored on a 0-100 basis using a ratio scale, where 0 means zero percent confidence and 100 means 100 percent confidence.

Criticality.documentation:
The updated value for the level of importance assigned to the resources associated with the findings.

A score of 0 means that the underlying resources have no criticality, and a score of 100 is reserved for the most critical resources.

FindingIdentifiers.documentation:
The list of findings to update. BatchUpdateFindings can be used to update up to 100 findings at a time.

For each finding, the list provides the finding identifier and the ARN of the finding provider.

RelatedFindings.documentation: A list of findings that are related to the updated findings.

Types.documentation:
One or more finding types in the format of namespace/category/classifier that classify a finding.

Valid namespace values are as follows.

  • Software and Configuration Checks

  • TTPs

  • Effects

  • Unusual Behaviors

  • Sensitive Data Identifications

UserDefinedFields.documentation: A list of name/value string pairs associated with the finding. These are custom, user-defined fields added to a finding.

VerificationState.documentation:
Indicates the veracity of a finding.

The available values for VerificationState are as follows.

  • UNKNOWN – The default disposition of a security finding

  • TRUE_POSITIVE – The security finding is confirmed

  • FALSE_POSITIVE – The security finding was determined to be a false alarm

  • BENIGN_POSITIVE – A special case of TRUE_POSITIVE where the finding doesn't pose any threat, is expected, or both

Workflow.documentation:
Used to update the workflow status of a finding.

The workflow status indicates the progress of the investigation into the finding.

ProcessedFindings.documentation: The list of findings that were updated successfully.

UnprocessedFindings.documentation: The list of findings that were not updated.

BatchUpdateFindingsUnprocessedFinding.documentation: A finding from a BatchUpdateFindings request that Security Hub was unable to update.

ErrorCode.documentation:
The code associated with the error. Possible values are:

  • ConcurrentUpdateError - Another request attempted to update the finding while this request was being processed. This error may also occur if you call BatchUpdateFindings and BatchImportFindings at the same time.

  • DuplicatedFindingIdentifier - The request included two or more findings with the same FindingIdentifier.

  • FindingNotFound - The FindingIdentifier included in the request did not match an existing finding.

  • FindingSizeExceeded - The finding size was greater than the permissible value of 240 KB.

  • InternalFailure - An internal service failure occurred when updating the finding.

  • InvalidInput - The finding update contained an invalid value that did not satisfy the Amazon Web Services Security Finding Format syntax.

ErrorMessage.documentation:
The message associated with the error. Possible values are:

  • Concurrent finding updates detected

  • Finding Identifier is duplicated

  • Finding Not Found

  • Finding size exceeded 240 KB

  • Internal service failure

  • Invalid Input

FindingIdentifier.documentation: The identifier of the finding that was not updated.

Cell.documentation: An occurrence of sensitive data detected in a Microsoft Excel workbook, comma-separated value (CSV) file, or tab-separated value (TSV) file.

CellReference.documentation: For a Microsoft Excel workbook, provides the location of the cell, as an absolute cell reference, that contains the data. For example, Sheet2!C5 for cell C5 on Sheet2.

Column.documentation: The column number of the column that contains the data. For a Microsoft Excel workbook, the column number corresponds to the alphabetical column identifiers. For example, a value of 1 for Column corresponds to the A column in the workbook.

ColumnName.documentation: The name of the column that contains the data.

Row.documentation: The row number of the row that contains the data.

AssociationId.documentation: The association ID for the IPv4 CIDR block.

CidrBlockState.documentation: Information about the state of the IPv4 CIDR block.

ClassificationResult.documentation: Details about the sensitive data that was detected on the resource.

AdditionalOccurrences.documentation: Indicates whether there are additional occurrences of sensitive data that are not included in the finding. This occurs when the number of occurrences exceeds the maximum that can be included.

CustomDataIdentifiers.documentation: Provides details about sensitive data that was identified based on customer-defined configuration.

MimeType.documentation: The type of content that the finding applies to.

SensitiveData.documentation: Provides details about sensitive data that was identified based on built-in configuration.

SizeClassified.documentation: The total size in bytes of the affected data.

Status.documentation: The current status of the sensitive data detection.

ClassificationStatus.documentation: Provides details about the current status of the sensitive data detection.

Code.documentation: The code that represents the status of the sensitive data detection.

Reason.documentation: A longer description of the current status of the sensitive data detection.

Compliance.documentation: Contains finding details that are specific to control-based findings. Only returned for findings generated from controls.

RelatedRequirements.documentation: For a control, the industry or regulatory framework requirements that are related to the control. The check for that control is aligned with these requirements.

Status.documentation:
The result of a standards check.

The valid values for Status are as follows.

    • PASSED - Standards check passed for all evaluated resources.

    • WARNING - Some information is missing or this check is not supported for your configuration.

    • FAILED - Standards check failed for at least one evaluated resource.

    • NOT_AVAILABLE - Check could not be performed due to a service outage, API error, or because the result of the Config evaluation was NOT_APPLICABLE. If the Config evaluation result was NOT_APPLICABLE, then after 3 days, Security Hub automatically archives the finding.

StatusReasons.documentation: For findings generated from controls, a list of reasons behind the value of Status. For the list of status reason codes and their meanings, see Standards-related information in the ASFF in the Security Hub User Guide.

ImageId.documentation: The identifier of the container image related to a finding.

ImageName.documentation: The name of the container image related to a finding.

LaunchedAt.documentation:
Indicates when the container started.

Uses the date-time format specified in RFC 3339 section 5.6, Internet Date/Time Format. The value cannot contain spaces. For example, 2020-03-22T13:22:13.933Z.

Name.documentation: The name of the container related to a finding.

Privileged.documentation: When this parameter is true, the container is given elevated privileges on the host container instance (similar to the root user).

VolumeMounts.documentation: Provides information about the mounting of a volume in a container.

CountryCode.documentation: The 2-letter ISO 3166 country code for the country.

Description.documentation: The description for the custom action target.

Id.documentation: The ID for the custom action target. Can contain up to 20 alphanumeric characters.

Name.documentation: The name of the custom action target. Can contain up to 20 characters.

ActionTargetArn.documentation: The ARN for the custom action target.

RegionLinkingMode.documentation:
Indicates whether to aggregate findings from all of the available Regions in the current partition. Also determines whether to automatically aggregate findings from new Regions as Security Hub supports them and you opt into them.

The selected option also determines how to use the Regions provided in the Regions list.

The options are as follows:

  • ALL_REGIONS - Indicates to aggregate findings from all of the Regions where Security Hub is enabled. When you choose this option, Security Hub also automatically aggregates findings from new Regions as Security Hub supports them and you opt into them.

  • ALL_REGIONS_EXCEPT_SPECIFIED - Indicates to aggregate findings from all of the Regions where Security Hub is enabled, except for the Regions listed in the Regions parameter. When you choose this option, Security Hub also automatically aggregates findings from new Regions as Security Hub supports them and you opt into them.

  • SPECIFIED_REGIONS - Indicates to aggregate findings only from the Regions listed in the Regions parameter. Security Hub does not automatically aggregate findings from new Regions.

Regions.documentation:
If RegionLinkingMode is ALL_REGIONS_EXCEPT_SPECIFIED, then this is a comma-separated list of Regions that do not aggregate findings to the aggregation Region.

If RegionLinkingMode is SPECIFIED_REGIONS, then this is a comma-separated list of Regions that do aggregate findings to the aggregation Region.

FindingAggregatorArn.documentation: The ARN of the finding aggregator. You use the finding aggregator ARN to retrieve details for, update, and stop finding aggregation.

RegionLinkingMode.documentation: Indicates whether to link all Regions, all Regions except for a list of excluded Regions, or a list of included Regions.

Regions.documentation: The list of excluded Regions or included Regions.

Filters.documentation: One or more attributes used to filter the findings included in the insight. The insight only includes findings that match the criteria defined in the filters.

GroupByAttribute.documentation: The attribute used to group the findings for the insight. The grouping attribute identifies the type of item that the insight applies to. For example, if an insight is grouped by resource identifier, then the insight produces a list of resource identifiers.

Name.documentation: The name of the custom insight to create.

AccountDetails.documentation: The list of accounts to associate with the Security Hub administrator account. For each account, the list includes the account ID and optionally the email address.

UnprocessedAccounts.documentation: The list of Amazon Web Services accounts that were not processed. For each account, the list includes the account ID and the email address.

CustomDataIdentifiersDetections.documentation: The list of detected instances of sensitive data.

Arn.documentation: The ARN of the custom identifier that was used to detect the sensitive data.

Count.documentation: The total number of occurrences of sensitive data that were detected.

Name.documentation: he name of the custom identifier that detected the sensitive data.

Occurrences.documentation: Details about the sensitive data that was detected.

CustomDataIdentifiersResult.documentation: Contains an instance of sensitive data that was detected by a customer-defined identifier.

Detections.documentation: The list of detected instances of sensitive data.

TotalCount.documentation: The total number of occurrences of sensitive data.

Cvss.documentation: CVSS scores from the advisory related to the vulnerability.

BaseVector.documentation: The base scoring vector for the CVSS score.

Source.documentation: The origin of the original CVSS score and vector.

Version.documentation: The version of CVSS for the CVSS score.

DataClassificationDetails.documentation: Provides details about sensitive data that was detected on a resource.

DetailedResultsLocation.documentation: The path to the folder or file that contains the sensitive data.

Result.documentation: The details about the sensitive data that was detected on the resource.

DateRange.documentation: A date range for the date filter.

End.documentation: An end date for the date filter.

Start.documentation: A start date for the date filter.

DateRange.documentation: A date range for the date filter.

Unit.documentation: A date range unit for the date filter.

Value.documentation: A date range value for the date filter.

AccountIds.documentation: The list of account IDs for the accounts from which to decline the invitations to Security Hub.

UnprocessedAccounts.documentation: The list of Amazon Web Services accounts that were not processed. For each account, the list includes the account ID and the email address.

ActionTargetArn.documentation: The ARN of the custom action target to delete.
The ARN of the custom action target that was deleted.

FindingAggregatorArn.documentation: The ARN of the finding aggregator to delete. To obtain the ARN, use ListFindingAggregators.

InsightArn.documentation: The ARN of the insight to delete.
The ARN of the insight that was deleted.

AccountIds.documentation: The list of the account IDs that sent the invitations to delete.

UnprocessedAccounts.documentation: The list of Amazon Web Services accounts for which the invitations were not deleted. For each account, the list includes the account ID and the email address.

AccountIds.documentation: The list of account IDs for the member accounts to delete.

UnprocessedAccounts.documentation: The list of Amazon Web Services accounts that were not deleted. For each account, the list includes the account ID and the email address.

ActionTargetArns.documentation: A list of custom action target ARNs for the custom action targets to retrieve.

MaxResults.documentation: The maximum number of results to return.

NextToken.documentation:
The token that is required for pagination. On your first call to the DescribeActionTargets operation, set the value of this parameter to NULL.

For subsequent calls to the operation, to continue listing data, set the value of this parameter to the value returned from the previous response.

ActionTargets.documentation: A list of ActionTarget objects. Each object includes the ActionTargetArn, Description, and Name of a custom action target available in Security Hub.

NextToken.documentation: The pagination token to use to request the next page of results.

HubArn.documentation: The ARN of the Hub resource to retrieve.

AutoEnableControls.documentation:
Whether to automatically enable new controls when they are added to standards that are enabled.

If set to true, then new controls for enabled standards are enabled automatically. If set to false, then new controls are not enabled.

HubArn.documentation: The ARN of the Hub resource that was retrieved.

SubscribedAt.documentation: The date and time when Security Hub was enabled in the account.

AutoEnable.documentation:
Whether to automatically enable Security Hub for new accounts in the organization.

If set to true, then Security Hub is enabled for new accounts. If set to false, then new accounts are not added automatically.

AutoEnableStandards.documentation:
Whether to automatically enable Security Hub default standards for new member accounts in the organization.

The default value of this parameter is equal to DEFAULT.

If equal to DEFAULT, then Security Hub default standards are automatically enabled for new member accounts. If equal to NONE, then default standards are not automatically enabled for new member accounts.

MemberAccountLimitReached.documentation: Whether the maximum number of allowed member accounts are already associated with the Security Hub administrator account.

MaxResults.documentation: The maximum number of results to return.

NextToken.documentation:
The token that is required for pagination. On your first call to the DescribeProducts operation, set the value of this parameter to NULL.

For subsequent calls to the operation, to continue listing data, set the value of this parameter to the value returned from the previous response.

ProductArn.documentation: The ARN of the integration to return.

NextToken.documentation: The pagination token to use to request the next page of results.

Products.documentation: A list of products, including details for each product.

MaxResults.documentation: The maximum number of security standard controls to return.

NextToken.documentation:
The token that is required for pagination. On your first call to the DescribeStandardsControls operation, set the value of this parameter to NULL.

For subsequent calls to the operation, to continue listing data, set the value of this parameter to the value returned from the previous response.

StandardsSubscriptionArn.documentation: The ARN of a resource that represents your subscription to a supported standard. To get the subscription ARNs of the standards you have enabled, use the GetEnabledStandards operation.

NextToken.documentation: The pagination token to use to request the next page of results.

MaxResults.documentation: The maximum number of standards to return.

NextToken.documentation:
The token that is required for pagination. On your first call to the DescribeStandards operation, set the value of this parameter to NULL.

For subsequent calls to the operation, to continue listing data, set the value of this parameter to the value returned from the previous response.
The pagination token to use to request the next page of results.

ProductSubscriptionArn.documentation: The ARN of the integrated product to disable the integration for.

AdminAccountId.documentation: The Amazon Web Services account identifier of the Security Hub administrator account.

AccountIds.documentation: The account IDs of the member accounts to disassociate from the administrator account.

DnsRequestAction.documentation: Provided if ActionType is DNS_REQUEST. It provides details about the DNS request that was detected.

Blocked.documentation: Indicates whether the DNS request was blocked.

Domain.documentation: The DNS domain that is associated with the DNS request.

Protocol.documentation: The protocol that was used for the DNS request.

ProductArn.documentation: The ARN of the product to enable the integration for.

ProductSubscriptionArn.documentation: The ARN of your subscription to the product to enable integrations for.

AdminAccountId.documentation: The Amazon Web Services account identifier of the account to designate as the Security Hub administrator account.

EnableDefaultStandards.documentation: Whether to enable the security standards that Security Hub has designated as automatically enabled. If you do not provide a value for EnableDefaultStandards, it is set to true. To not enable the automatically enabled standards, set EnableDefaultStandards to false.

Tags.documentation: The tags to add to the hub resource when you enable Security Hub.

FilePaths.documentation: Provides information about the file paths that were affected by the threat.

FileName.documentation: The name of the infected or suspicious file corresponding to the hash.

FilePath.documentation: Path to the infected or suspicious file on the resource it was detected on.

Hash.documentation: The hash value for the infected or suspicious file.

ResourceId.documentation: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the resource on which the threat was detected.

FindingAggregator.documentation: A finding aggregator. A finding aggregator contains the configuration for finding aggregation.

FindingAggregatorArn.documentation: The ARN of the finding aggregator. You use the finding aggregator ARN to retrieve details for, update, and delete the finding aggregator.

FindingProviderFields.documentation: In a BatchImportFindings request, finding providers use FindingProviderFields to provide and update values for confidence, criticality, related findings, severity, and types.

Confidence.documentation:
A finding's confidence. Confidence is defined as the likelihood that a finding accurately identifies the behavior or issue that it was intended to identify.

Confidence is scored on a 0-100 basis using a ratio scale, where 0 means zero percent confidence and 100 means 100 percent confidence.

Criticality.documentation:
The level of importance assigned to the resources associated with the finding.

A score of 0 means that the underlying resources have no criticality, and a score of 100 is reserved for the most critical resources.

RelatedFindings.documentation: A list of findings that are related to the current finding.

Types.documentation:
One or more finding types in the format of namespace/category/classifier that classify a finding.

Valid namespace values are: Software and Configuration Checks | TTPs | Effects | Unusual Behaviors | Sensitive Data Identifications

FindingProviderSeverity.documentation: The severity assigned to the finding by the finding provider.

Label.documentation: The severity label assigned to the finding by the finding provider.

Original.documentation: The finding provider's original value for the severity.

StatefulRuleGroupReferences.documentation: The stateful rule groups that are used in the firewall policy.

StatelessCustomActions.documentation: The custom action definitions that are available to use in the firewall policy's StatelessDefaultActions setting.

StatelessDefaultActions.documentation:
The actions to take on a packet if it doesn't match any of the stateless rules in the policy.

You must specify a standard action (aws:pass, aws:drop, aws:forward_to_sfe), and can optionally include a custom action from StatelessCustomActions.

StatelessFragmentDefaultActions.documentation:
The actions to take on a fragmented UDP packet if it doesn't match any of the stateless rules in the policy.

You must specify a standard action (aws:pass, aws:drop, aws:forward_to_sfe), and can optionally include a custom action from StatelessCustomActions.

StatelessRuleGroupReferences.documentation: The stateless rule groups that are used in the firewall policy.

FirewallPolicyStatefulRuleGroupReference.documentation: A stateful rule group that is used by the firewall policy.

ResourceArn.documentation: The ARN of the stateful rule group.

FirewallPolicyStatelessCustomActionsDeta.documentation: A custom action that can be used for stateless packet handling.

FirewallPolicyStatelessRuleGroupReferenc.documentation: A stateless rule group that is used by the firewall policy.

Priority.documentation: The order in which to run the stateless rule group.

ResourceArn.documentation: The ARN of the stateless rule group.

GeoLocation.documentation: Provides the latitude and longitude coordinates of a location.

MaxResults.documentation: The maximum number of results to return in the response.

NextToken.documentation:
The token that is required for pagination. On your first call to the GetEnabledStandards operation, set the value of this parameter to NULL.

For subsequent calls to the operation, to continue listing data, set the value of this parameter to the value returned from the previous response.

StandardsSubscriptionArns.documentation: The list of the standards subscription ARNs for the standards to retrieve.

NextToken.documentation: The pagination token to use to request the next page of results.

StandardsSubscriptions.documentation: The list of StandardsSubscriptions objects that include information about the enabled standards.

FindingAggregatorArn.documentation: The ARN of the finding aggregator to return details for. To obtain the ARN, use ListFindingAggregators.

RegionLinkingMode.documentation: Indicates whether to link all Regions, all Regions except for a list of excluded Regions, or a list of included Regions.

Regions.documentation: The list of excluded Regions or included Regions.

Filters.documentation:
The finding attributes used to define a condition to filter the returned findings.

You can filter by up to 10 finding attributes. For each attribute, you can provide up to 20 filter values.

Note that in the available filter fields, WorkflowState is deprecated. To search for a finding based on its workflow status, use WorkflowStatus.

MaxResults.documentation: The maximum number of findings to return.

NextToken.documentation:
The token that is required for pagination. On your first call to the GetFindings operation, set the value of this parameter to NULL.

For subsequent calls to the operation, to continue listing data, set the value of this parameter to the value returned from the previous response.

SortCriteria.documentation: The finding attributes used to sort the list of returned findings.

Findings.documentation: The findings that matched the filters specified in the request.

NextToken.documentation: The pagination token to use to request the next page of results.

InsightArn.documentation: The ARN of the insight for which to return results.

InsightResults.documentation: The insight results returned by the operation.

InsightArns.documentation: The ARNs of the insights to describe. If you do not provide any insight ARNs, then GetInsights returns all of your custom insights. It does not return any managed insights.

MaxResults.documentation: The maximum number of items to return in the response.

NextToken.documentation:
The token that is required for pagination. On your first call to the GetInsights operation, set the value of this parameter to NULL.

For subsequent calls to the operation, to continue listing data, set the value of this parameter to the value returned from the previous response.
The pagination token to use to request the next page of results.

InvitationsCount.documentation: The number of all membership invitations sent to this Security Hub member account, not including the currently accepted invitation.

Master.documentation: A list of details about the Security Hub administrator account for the current member account.

AccountIds.documentation: The list of account IDs for the Security Hub member accounts to return the details for.

Members.documentation: The list of details about the Security Hub member accounts.

UnprocessedAccounts.documentation: The list of Amazon Web Services accounts that could not be processed. For each account, the list includes the account ID and the email address.

IcmpTypeCode.documentation: An Internet Control Message Protocol (ICMP) type and code.

Code.documentation: The ICMP code for which to deny or allow access. To deny or allow all codes, use the value -1.

Type.documentation: The ICMP type for which to deny or allow access. To deny or allow all types, use the value -1.

ImportFindingsError.documentation: The list of the findings that cannot be imported. For each finding, the list provides the error.

ErrorCode.documentation: The code of the error returned by the BatchImportFindings operation.

ErrorMessage.documentation: The message of the error returned by the BatchImportFindings operation.

Id.documentation: The identifier of the finding that could not be updated.

Insight.documentation: Contains information about a Security Hub insight.

Filters.documentation: One or more attributes used to filter the findings included in the insight. The insight only includes findings that match the criteria defined in the filters.

GroupByAttribute.documentation: The grouping attribute for the insight's findings. Indicates how to group the matching findings, and identifies the type of item that the insight applies to. For example, if an insight is grouped by resource identifier, then the insight produces a list of resource identifiers.

InsightArn.documentation: The ARN of a Security Hub insight.

Name.documentation: The name of a Security Hub insight.

InsightResultValue.documentation: The insight result values returned by the GetInsightResults operation.

Count.documentation: The number of findings returned for each GroupByAttributeValue.

GroupByAttributeValue.documentation: The value of the attribute that the findings are grouped by for the insight whose results are returned by the GetInsightResults operation.

InsightResults.documentation: The insight results returned by the GetInsightResults operation.

GroupByAttribute.documentation: The attribute that the findings are grouped by for the insight whose results are returned by the GetInsightResults operation.

InsightArn.documentation: The ARN of the insight whose results are returned by the GetInsightResults operation.

ResultValues.documentation: The list of insight result values returned by the GetInsightResults operation.

InvalidAccessException.documentation: There is an issue with the account used to make the request. Either Security Hub is not enabled for the account, or the account does not have permission to perform this action.

InvalidInputException.documentation: The request was rejected because you supplied an invalid or out-of-range value for an input parameter.

AccountId.documentation: The account ID of the Security Hub administrator account that the invitation was sent from.

InvitationId.documentation: The ID of the invitation sent to the member account.

InvitedAt.documentation: The timestamp of when the invitation was sent.

MemberStatus.documentation: The current status of the association between the member and administrator accounts.

AccountIds.documentation: The list of account IDs of the Amazon Web Services accounts to invite to Security Hub as members.

UnprocessedAccounts.documentation: The list of Amazon Web Services accounts that could not be processed. For each account, the list includes the account ID and the email address.

Asn.documentation: The Autonomous System Number (ASN) of the internet provider

AsnOrg.documentation: The name of the organization that registered the ASN.

Isp.documentation: The ISP information for the internet provider.

AssociationId.documentation: The association ID for the IPv6 CIDR block.

CidrBlockState.documentation:
Information about the state of the CIDR block. Valid values are as follows:

  • associating

  • associated

  • disassociating

  • disassociated

  • failed

  • failing

LimitExceededException.documentation: The request was rejected because it attempted to create resources beyond the current Amazon Web Services account or throttling limits. The error code describes the limit exceeded.

MaxResults.documentation: The maximum number of items to return in the response.

NextToken.documentation:
The token that is required for pagination. On your first call to the ListEnabledProductsForImport operation, set the value of this parameter to NULL.

For subsequent calls to the operation, to continue listing data, set the value of this parameter to the value returned from the previous response.
The pagination token to use to request the next page of results.

ProductSubscriptions.documentation: The list of ARNs for the resources that represent your subscriptions to products.

MaxResults.documentation: The maximum number of results to return. This operation currently only returns a single result.

NextToken.documentation: The token returned with the previous set of results. Identifies the next set of results to return.

FindingAggregators.documentation: The list of finding aggregators. This operation currently only returns a single result.

NextToken.documentation:
If there are more results, this is the token to provide in the next call to ListFindingAggregators.

This operation currently only returns a single result.

MaxResults.documentation: The maximum number of items to return in the response.

NextToken.documentation:
The token that is required for pagination. On your first call to the ListInvitations operation, set the value of this parameter to NULL.

For subsequent calls to the operation, to continue listing data, set the value of this parameter to the value returned from the previous response.

Invitations.documentation: The details of the invitations returned by the operation.

NextToken.documentation: The pagination token to use to request the next page of results.

MaxResults.documentation: The maximum number of items to return in the response.

NextToken.documentation:
The token that is required for pagination. On your first call to the ListMembers operation, set the value of this parameter to NULL.

For subsequent calls to the operation, to continue listing data, set the value of this parameter to the value returned from the previous response.

OnlyAssociated.documentation:
Specifies which member accounts to include in the response based on their relationship status with the administrator account. The default value is TRUE.

If OnlyAssociated is set to TRUE, the response includes member accounts whose relationship status with the administrator account is set to ENABLED.

If OnlyAssociated is set to FALSE, the response includes all existing member accounts.

NextToken.documentation: The pagination token to use to request the next page of results.

MaxResults.documentation: The maximum number of items to return in the response.

NextToken.documentation: The token that is required for pagination. On your first call to the ListOrganizationAdminAccounts operation, set the value of this parameter to NULL. For subsequent calls to the operation, to continue listing data, set the value of this parameter to the value returned from the previous response.

AdminAccounts.documentation: The list of Security Hub administrator accounts.

NextToken.documentation: The pagination token to use to request the next page of results.

ResourceArn.documentation: The ARN of the resource to retrieve tags for.

LoadBalancerState.documentation: Information about the state of the load balancer.

Code.documentation:
The state code. The initial state of the load balancer is provisioning.

After the load balancer is fully set up and ready to route traffic, its state is active.

If the load balancer could not be set up, its state is failed.

Malware.documentation: A list of malware related to a finding.

Name.documentation: The name of the malware that was observed.

Path.documentation: The file system path of the malware that was observed.

State.documentation: The state of the malware that was observed.

Type.documentation: The type of the malware that was observed.

MapFilter.documentation: A map filter for querying findings. Each map filter provides the field to check, the value to look for, and the comparison operator.

Comparison.documentation:
The condition to apply to the key value when querying for findings with a map filter.

To search for values that exactly match the filter value, use EQUALS. For example, for the ResourceTags field, the filter Department EQUALS Security matches findings that have the value Security for the tag Department.

To search for values other than the filter value, use NOT_EQUALS. For example, for the ResourceTags field, the filter Department NOT_EQUALS Finance matches findings that do not have the value Finance for the tag Department.

EQUALS filters on the same field are joined by OR. A finding matches if it matches any one of those filters.

NOT_EQUALS filters on the same field are joined by AND. A finding matches only if it matches all of those filters.

You cannot have both an EQUALS filter and a NOT_EQUALS filter on the same field.

Key.documentation: The key of the map filter. For example, for ResourceTags, Key identifies the name of the tag. For UserDefinedFields, Key is the name of the field.

Value.documentation: The value for the key in the map filter. Filter values are case sensitive. For example, one of the values for a tag called Department might be Security. If you provide security as the filter value, then there is no match.

AccountId.documentation: The Amazon Web Services account ID of the member account.

AdministratorId.documentation: The Amazon Web Services account ID of the Security Hub administrator account associated with this member account.

Email.documentation: The email address of the member account.

InvitedAt.documentation: A timestamp for the date and time when the invitation was sent to the member account.

MasterId.deprecatedMessage: This field is deprecated, use AdministratorId instead.
MasterId.documentation:
This is replaced by AdministratorID.

The Amazon Web Services account ID of the Security Hub administrator account associated with this member account.

MemberStatus.documentation:
The status of the relationship between the member account and its administrator account.

The status can have one of the following values:

  • CREATED - Indicates that the administrator account added the member account, but has not yet invited the member account.
